support.title: Cryptographic signature

Ebooks are delivered digitally as MOBIs and EPUBs, audiobooks are delivered as MP3s. All are DRM-free and unencumbered by license agreements or terms of service. You bought 'em, you own 'em.

support.title: Commission a Little Brother story
support.descp: We come up with a mutually agreeable prompt for a story set in the Little Brother universe...I write it. Anywhere I publish it, it will have your name on it as the commissioner.

support.title: The original ending of Little Brother
support.descp: The first draft of Little Brother had a VERY different ending. No one except my editor and my agent have even seen it. I will hand-copy it for you in my atrocious handwriting and mail it to you to use as you see fit.

support.title: LOVE OF LITERATURE
support.descp: Perhaps you have enough books on your shelf, but you just love this project and want to bring this book into the hands of other readers. feel free to contribute at any level, and we'll send a thank you note for your generosity.

support.title: A printed copy of the Book!
support.descp: Get a first edition copy of Rediscovering America : A 21st Century Journey by Brian Kahn!

support.title: A copy of the book SIGNED by Brian Kahn
support.descp: Get a first edition printing of America: Rediscovering My Country, signed by the author (personally inscribed if you wish!)

support.title: Rediscovering America & BONUS
support.descp: For a $100 contribution, you will receive copies of both Rediscovering America : A 21st Century Journey and Brian's previous book, Real Common Sense, signed by the author! Real Common Sense offers an excellent strategy for overcoming the political polarization in America, making it an excellent companion piece to Rediscovering America : A 21st Century Journey. You will enjoy having them both!

support.title: DRUMLUMMON SUITE
support.descp: For a contribution toward this project of $125, you will receive a copy of Rediscovering America : A 21st Century Journey, and copies of Drumlummon's other most recent titles! It will be a slate of awesome Montana literature to get you through the fall and winter! In addition to Brian's book, you'll get a copy of the great Butte poet Ed Lahey's MOVING ON: THE LAST POEMS, as well as beloved poet and philosopher Roger Dunsmore's ON THE CHINESE WALL: NEW AND SELECTED POEMS.

support.title: LISTED AS A CONTRIBUTOR
support.descp: For a contribution of $250 to this project, we'll list your name on a special thank you page in the first edition printing of Rediscovering America : A 21st Century Journey. You'll also receive a signed copy of the book, with a personalized inscription if you wish!

support.title: PUBLIC LIBRARIES
support.descp: Perhaps you would like to see this important book available at public libraries! For a contribution of $500 we will make sure that 20 Montana public libraries receive copies of Rediscovering America : A 21st Century Journey. We'll cover postage and send you a list of recipients. Or perhaps you have specific libraries in mind--we'll confer with you about where to send the books!

campaign.story:
With our first two campaigns out of the way, and more than 2800 of our rulers being used all over the world, we've decided to launch something a little different for one week only...
Introducing the CarbonCover!
The CarbonCover is a small, discrete and extremely easy to install premium webcam cover that protects you from being spied on. (We also use them to prevent the camera getting scratched on things like our iPads and phones.)
Cyber security is a big deal these days. We've all heard the stories that range from companies being hacked and vast amounts of data being stolen, to mass surveillance recording and gathering data on everything we do. Along with protecting the files on your devices, protecting yourselves (and others) is just as important!
Held securely in place with 3M adhesive backing, the CarbonCovers will fit to a vast range of devices - be it laptops, all-in-one desktops, tablets or even smartphones. A quick swipe of the finger will slide the cap to either reveal, or cover the camera lens. Fitted in seconds and easy to remove without causing any damage. They're made from the same premium materials as our last campaign, which really helps set them apart from the rest. Why use plastic when you can use carbon fibre?
Super easy to install 
Open or close the cover whenever you need with one finger
2 part carbon fibre construction
3M adhesive backing
At 1mm thick you're able to close your laptop lid on it no problem
Our aim was not to create 'the thinnest webcam cover in the world', but rather, the best. (And the most carbon-y.)
We're fully aware that there is nothing new with the concept of covering up your webcam. Many people (famously including Mark Zuckerberg and former FBI head James Comey) use a little square of tape - as do many people that are interested in cyber-privacy. 
The problem with tape - as we've discovered for the last year or so of using it - is that it's not very practical. It needs to be removed when you want the camera and leaves a residue when you peel it off. They also ruin the look of your devices...
Already use tape? Go for a practicality and style upgrade with the CarbonCover! 
The CarbonCover fully blocks the webcam when closed, but a handy feature (tested on Apple devices) is that the LED indication light remains exposed - so whether a program you're using, a dodgy website or a hacker activates the webcam, you'll be aware of this even though they're not recording any image. 
But why do I need to cover my webcam?
Programs often sold as 'spy on your ex-girlfriend software' are available on the internet and allow people to spy on you using the webcam or front-facing cameras built into your devices. Simply put, if someone can control your webcam and record anything they want - isn’t this something you’d like to prevent? With access to a webcam, people can capture everything and privacy no longer exists. Closed door meetings at work, your children playing in the living room or even things far more intimate can all be targets for users of this type of software. (more on this at the bottom!)
Doing things differently. 
There have been several campaigns for webcam covers that have come and gone on Kickstarter before ours, with many of you probably having backed them! Unfortunately, it seems that there have been numerous issues with them. Everything from flimsy construction and unfeasibly small/thin components, through to supply chain issues, rewards simply not turning up and no communication from the creators.
We hope our simple approach to the design, and great track record of delivering a large volume of high quality carbon parts to backers all over the world will inspire a bit more confidence and keep as many of you safe from webcam hackers as possible!
Design & Prototyping.
With dimensions of 16.5 x 11 x 1mm, the CarbonCover is tiny. It's small enough to be completely unobtrusive, and yet its rounded edges and glossy carbon twill compliment the design of your device and really set itself apart from other webcam covers on the market. The best selling covers on sites like Amazon are also 1mm thick and in all the testing we've been doing we're yet to find an issue with closing a laptop lid on it.
Those rulers look familiar...
To develop these covers we began by speaking to our fantastic manufacturing partners. With their advice on board, we made sure the design wouldn't be an issue for the manufacturing tolerances we've come to expect from them - a key area we feel many other campaigns have failed on due to designs that are unrealistic for accurate and consistent machining in large quantities. 
A few 3d printed prototypes later we were able to order our first batch of CarbonCovers to carry on testing. The comparatively large surface area for the 3M adhesive backing ensures the CarbonCover stays firmly in place on all your devices. The sliding lens cap is really easy to open and close with a single flick of the finger. No messy glue or magnets involved here! While the adhesive will remain sticky if you choose to remove the cover and apply to another device, we include a spare adhesive ring for just this eventuality! 
Rewards and Incentives.
They say imitation is the sincerest form of flattery, so it's in that spirit that we're 'imitating' the superb incentive we've recently seen on the Universal Lens Cap campaign. If you like the CarbonCover, back it at whatever quantity takes your fancy - then share it with your friends and followers on social media to receive 1 FREE ADDITIONAL COVER! (Don't forget to post the link in the comment section above!)
 Will the CarbonCovers fit my devices?
CarbonCovers can be secured to any device with a camera of up to 4.6mm in diameter. We have come across some larger webcams on old laptops, but the CarbonCover still works just fine. In these instances the edges of the cover may be just visible when you're using the webcam, but it will still be perfectly usable for skype/etc. When in the closed position, the lens is fully covered. 
A few of the comments from happy backers last time around!
 Tell me more about webcam spying!
At just over a minute in length this video perfectly demonstrates why you want to have your webcam covered. It is now common knowledge that intelligence organisations around the world can access a webcam without the user ever knowing. However, the bigger privacy threat is actually from hackers, blackmailers and cyber stalkers - thanks mostly to the software being so easy to get hold of and install. If the CarbonCover isn't for you, and you don't fancy buying any of the alternatives, at least grab a bit of tape and get those cameras covered! 
A webcam cover gives peace of mind during intimate and private moments. How much do you value your privacy?
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
It's definitely true that every project comes with its own unique risks and challenges. However, given that we're using the same tried and tested manufacturers and shipping/fulfilment company here in the UK, we're confident that we'll be able to get all orders dispatched just as the previous two campaigns! 

We've had words with our manufacturing partners about their Chinese New Year closing times and have taken these delays into account! 

We believe communication is key, and will always keep you informed at all stages of production and shipping! Your orders will be dispatched by Royal Mail 1st class (as we do every time). If you would like to pay extra for a courier with a tracking number, please message us directly and we can sort this out!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
All of your orders are now picked & packed with the address labels fitted too.
Today, all of the UK and EU orders were posted. Tomorrow the N.America & ROW orders will be sent, so everything is done! 
(ran out of time today to post everything, and also ran out of customs stickers!!)
Right on schedule, we've had the CarbonCovers arrive!

Under a week since the campaign ended and already we've got everything ordered!
Typically with a Kickstarter campaign the creators have to wait at least 14 days (more like 18 in the UK!) for any funds to be released, however, what with Chinese New Year and a solid 95% of your pledges being collected first time around, we knew it wasn't worth waiting for.

Only 24hrs to go!
We've been blown away by the interest surrounding our CarbonCovers this week, and their success is entirely down to you!
Creators typically use these last 24hrs as a call to action for their backers, but with all the sharing on social media you've been doing, and the kind words in messages, we'll give you a bit of peace and quiet!

What an amazing 2nd day we've had! 
The interest in our CarbonCovers continue to grow, and thats all down to you amazing backers.
We've just added bigger bundles - a 10 pack, and a 30 pack. (up to 11x and 31x when you share!) This was a direct response to the popularity of our 5x bundle. If this deal suits you better, feel free to modify those pledges - the postage cost remains the same!

5pm brings the first day of this campaign to a close, and we cannot thank you all enough! 
Over 300% funded, and with so many of you sharing the link on your Twitter and Facebook accounts, we're super excited to see how far this can go - and how many peoples privacy we can help protect!

campaign.story:
Welcome to RHEEA Tech’s Campaign for PISA Light  
    Many of us follow the practice of carrying keychain flashlight wherever we go. But, the problem we face is that those tiny button cell batteries that generally power our flashlight are to be replaced frequently. In some instances, it takes very longer for us to replace the old button cell batteries as they are too small.
Tough job for your big hand to work on such tiny battery.
    Can you imagine carrying a keychain flashlight that is just equivalent to the size of a paper clip that comes with rechargeable battery? Yes, such a light called as PISA light in attractive colors is launched by us at RHEEA Tech. Welcome to our Kickstarter Campaign for this small colorful rechargeable EDC flashlight. This practical, trendy and minimal light is not just a light. It is in fact, a stylish and the most useful modern accessory for carrying along every day. 
 What is Pisa Light
        At RHEEA Tech, we have meticulously crafted this small light. This miniature light is most elegantly designed. The small size will make it your best companion besides ensuring your safety during darkness. We are happy to share that we have taken your convenience to the next level by creating this light as a rechargeable light. So, you can save your money on frequently changing the battery. As it comes with a keychain, you can
just attach your keys that you should carry along with you.
PISA LIGHT is designed  both a trendy accessory and a practical EDC item.
    At RHEEA Tech, we have meticulously crafted this small light. This miniature light is most elegantly designed. The small size will make it your best companion besides ensuring your safety during darkness.
You Never Know When You Need Light Urgently. 
      We are happy to share that we have taken your convenience to the next level by creating this light as a rechargeable light. So, you can save your money on frequently changing the battery. As it comes with a keychain, you can just attach your keys that you should carry along with you.     You can recharge this gadget on your mobile phone using a USB cable. Even, you can charge it on a power socket using your mobile adapter or on your computer. The colorful designs will make it the best companion if you are highly particular about your style.
User Friendly, Stylish Design, It's PISA Light
 Excellent and Attractive Set of Features:  
   This key chain light will turn out to be special as against other such lights available in the market because of its excellent set of features. Here, let us introduce the features:  
It's A Light For Night Time, And Is A Decoration In Day Time. 
Powerful Brightness:   
    You can compare the brightness provided by other such tiny lights that come with 4 button cell batteries. Yes, our light will bring you 5 lm additional brightness without requiring you to change the button cell batteries that cost you more. Yes, when normal flash lights bring you 10 lm as the utmost brightness, you will get 15 lm brightness from PISA. 
15 lm is powerful for such a small light.
Water Resistance:  
In some instances, you might get caught in the rain when you carry the light. To make sure that the rain does not affect the brightness of the light, we at RHEEA Tech have designed this light as a water resistant flash light. So, you can stay confident about having a companion even in rainy season when power outages are common to happen.
Water Resistance Is Necessary For Outdoor Using.
Small Size and Light Weight:  
In addition to being smaller in appearance, the light is also designed as a lightweight model. Most people do not want to carry a heavy and large flashlight. We have rightly understood this requirement and so we have managed the technical limitation of size of rechargeable flashlight. Yes, this is the world’s smallest rechargeable flashlight at the present situation. Even though you carry it along with you wherever you go, you will never feel it.
PISA Is The World's Smallest Flashlight Now.
Charging Indicator:  
This small flash light comes with a charging indicator. This will ensure that the light is not over charged or undercharged. Yes, charging indicator is attractively designed in such a small body by our technicians. Once charged, the indicator light will switch off automatically.
Red Light Indicator Built In. 
Rechargeable: 
    This is a feature that is highly worthy. With this feature, you need not have to spend on costly button cell batteries that small flash lights generally come with. 
Micro USB Input, The Same To Most Smartphone
Specification
Product Materials: Aircraft Grade Aluminum Alloy
Light Sources:       Nichia 5mm white light LED
Size:                      Ø12mm*39mm 
Weight:                  8 grams Beam
Distance:               10 meters  
Power Sources:     70 mAh, Lithium Polymer 
Runtime:                Approx 5 hours
Water resistance:   IPX4
Features:               Switch On/Off by rotating.
                              Charging Indicator   
Protection:             Overcharge, Over-Discharge, Over Voltage,
                              Over-current, and Low Voltage Cut-Off.
Size Comparison
Colors: 
Please tell us the color you want in backer survey after campaign succeeds..
Our Development
2 Years Hard Working on PISA LIGHT 
It's not a problem to design a new rechargeable flashlight. However, making it as small as regular mini flashlight with button cell is really A BIG CHALLENGE! There are LED, Battery, Wires, Charger, Electronic Circuits, Spring...etc. in such a small cavity, no space can be wasted. RHEEA Team finally get over the difficulty without quality sacrificed, well, even better.  
• So Many Parts Jammed Into Such A Small Cavity.
 • Initial Prototype
 • Prototype Of Final Version
    Physical appearance design is a very interesting process. Decades of deigns was born before the final one, even some of them are very unique. It's a hard work to generate so many design, and it's even harder to choose one that every one loves among so many designs.
• Some Ideas were quite unique
  • Final Design
    2 years of hard working on PISA Light, we believe PISA LIGHT will be the new gadget you most want to have.
    Back Us, Get your PISA Light before others in the world.
***Patent pending***

 We can guarantee that this product is ready for mass production and we surely can deliver the product to all backer within the timeline we promised. The only thing missing is your support and your pledges.

campaign.story:
Better than any other. Introduction to KAL
This minimalistic, perpetual wall calendar is made of an aluminum base and six double-sided paper sheets you can write on. It’s an essential everyday personal organizer. The convenient, carefully designed grid allows you to write down appointments, keep track of your schedule, and see everything at a glance – making plans has never been this easy.
KAL is functionally and visually simple. No unnecessary elements, no superfluous graphics, no pictures, no fast-aging styling – we aim for the timeless. 
    Kal in all its splendor
    Functionally and visually simple. No unnecessary elements, no superfluous graphics, no pictures, no fast-aging styling – we aim for the timeless
         Switching the month thick paper sheets
    Created for planning
The KAL is a tool for planning your daily activities, jotting down reminders and establishing long-term goals. Its visual appearance is pared down to what’s essential, and the smart layout will help you stay on track and remember your important appointments. 
The well-planned grid allows enough space for adding text, while remaining very readable, so you have an easy overview of your weekly or monthly plans.
  Smart layout will help you stay on track and remember your important appointments or events
    See everything at a glance – making plans has never been this easy
  The well-planned grid allows enough space for adding text, while remaining very readable, so you have an easy overview of your weekly or monthly plans
  Closed cycle. Designed to last
The KAL is built to last. The planned closed cycle and carefully designed form will allow you to use it year after year. We care about the planet, which is why we selected recyclable aluminum and carefully chose FSC- and PEFC-certified thick paper, for a sustainable, responsible, high-quality product. Towards the end of a year, simply order new pages and recycle the old ones. KAL is designed to last you a lifetime, and we’re sure you’ll come to depend on it!
  Planned closed cycle and carefully designed form will allow you to use it year after year
  Recyclable aluminum and carefully chose paper, for a sustainable, responsible, high-quality product
  Stay more analog
Our digital era provides a great number of apps and other productivity boosters, but we believe in the value of traditional time-planning tools. That’s why we wanted to work specifically on a wall calendar, analyzing which details and subtleties are essential for a truly great design.
Digital calendars typically overflow with requests and reminders, Kal is a space of infinite autonomy where the user chooses what to make time for.
  The value of traditional time-planning tool
    Design piece
The KAL is not just a typical planner. Its aesthetics and pleasure of use create an emotional response in the user. The KAL is not visually imposing, but it will surely be an important element of your home, elegantly complementing the decor. You’ll never tire of its look.
  Kal's looks fit easily into any daily space. Even better, it improve the aesthetics of that space
    Online shop 
After the Kickstarter campaign we’ll launch an online shop, where you can order new month pages for 16$, or whole calendar sets. Visit www.kal-store.com  
Solid delivery package with a great silkscreen graphic
  Story
My name is Stanislaw, I'm an industrial designer from Warsaw, Poland. I run my own Umiar Studio which works for leading design brands, such as Ikea and Menu. I truly believe in the value of clear and functional forms of everyday objects. I had always a big dream to launch and produce own project. Now I'm ready!
  Rewards
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
We are determined to deliver your KAL's by the end of the year, so that you can enjoy them as soon as possible. The KAL is a physical item, so of course manufacturing and shipping hazards can’t be completely ruled out, but we truly believe that the process will be made smoother by our experience in manufacturing, our knowledge of production techniques and above all our close relation with the producers.

Over the last three years we have worked with a small group of clients on testing the KAL design. Their valuable feedback has allowed us to continuously improve the KAL. All those hours spent on researching, testing, prototyping and discussing have helped us achieve an elegant, easy design that is complete and ready to produce.

We are committed to getting the KAL to all of you on time. 
Thank you for your valuable support!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
Any unlocked stretch goals will be sent to each backer for free, as thanks for supporting our kickstarter campaign
                     GRIM WORKSHOP
Grim Workshop's high-quality artisan made, everyday carry tool systems are designed and produced in the U.S.A. out of premium surgical grade stainless steel. Our tools are produced with the utmost attention and care to their functions and use. Grim Workshop creates some of the world's smallest multi-function everyday carry tools for people from all walks of life. From the ordinary to the extraordinary, Grim has a tool for it. From camping, first aid, survival items, emergency tools, and everyday tool kits, tools for anything and everything life has to throw at you: Grim Everyday Carry Tool Systems. Though they may be small, they are mighty.
 Grim EDC Zipper Tools
Grim Workshop's Everyday Carry Zipper Tool System was designed to turn any bag, backpack, or any other item they can be attatched to into a wearable, mobile tool kit for almost any situation. At under 1mm thick these tools are ultra-lite but still strong, and made from high grade surgical stainless steel by Artisan craftsmen and women, and are 100% designed and produced right here in the U.S.A.  
all 12 of Grim's Zipper tools are made of surgical grade stainless steel, designed and produced here in the U.S.A with the utmost care and attention provided to their development.
From combs, to wrenches, lockpicks, fishing kits and more we wanted to give you the items for any situation without ever having to dig or search through pockets, with the tools readily available you never have to look long to find what you need.
Materials  
All of Grim Workshop's metal tools are made from surgical grade stainless steel, and are under 1mm thick.
    We now have over 20 tools available, and 7 total bundles.
Reusable 
Grims EDC tools that have removable parts like our lockpick, fishing hooks, etc. All have a special tool retention system applied to the back of them. This allows you to take a piece of a tool use it, and return it to its original position to be used again at another date.
Grim EDC Tools placed onto a bag. Multiple tools can be stored onto one zipper slot.
Go anywhere  
At under 1mm thick all 12 tools can be stacked into an area smaller than one AA battery. This allows you to take them and store them just about anywhere you can imagine, making them the ultimate travel companion. Imagine having a toolbox in your pocket or on your keychain without ever having to dig into a pouch or search for an item.
Grim zippers stored on a paracord bracelet
Grim's EDC zipper tools are not just for bags and backpacks though, they can also be worn as an EDC keychain, necklace, inside a small tin or pouch, stored on a bracelet, or even extra small spaces like inside the rim of a hat.
  All 12 tools currently available. Every tool comes with a small clip allowing you to easily attach and remove your tools in just a few seconds
  Picture of our Wire/Line Spool before and after being wrapped.
  Grims EDC Tool Bundles. All four bundles are pictured with clips and holders. Each bundle can be used as a whole or separated into smaller groups so you can carry as a zipper, keychain, necklace, or just about any other way imaginable.
Grims bundles are designed as a convenient carry system to keep our tools silent as well as keep our sharper tools safely sheathed.
    Some of our tools, and what you can do with them.
   Add our necklace add on to any pledge, a great way to carry your micro edc tools, up to 10 tools can be stored in this necklace. just add 7$ to your pledge total
  Add our wallet carry attachment to any pledge for an additional 7$
 Grim's wallet tool holder allows you to store up to 6 tools at a time on a credit card sized tool holder. One side has our custom tool retention system that holds your tools, and the other has a special reusable glow light. 30 minutes of sun or bright light allows for 8-10 hours of glow time. 
                      Coming Up  
      With over a dozen tools having already had their final prototypes created approved and production ready, we have no less than 9 more tools currently being prototype and will hopefully become available after our campaign has begun. We hope you will become a part of seeing these tools become a reality. 
thank you from the Grim Workshop family
Grim Everyday Carry Tool Systems, 
Though they may be small, they are mighty.

updates.update_userinfo: Grim Workshop is back on Kickstarter!
updates.update_content:
Were BACK!
 Hey guys! i just wanted to update you all and let you know that we're back on kickstarter! Thanks to your support of our last campaign, we've been able to expand into using new materials, like leather, and we've begun to partner with other great companies to bring more awesome new tools to the world. so with that said, please allow me to introduce, the Grim Everyday Carry Tool Roll Wallet

So many return backers
Wow, in these last few hours of this incredibly successful campaign, we wanted to take a moment to say thank you, to everyone who decided to back us for a second round on Kickstarter! We cant believe how many of you came back, and how successful you helped this campaign to be. From the bottom of our hearts, we thank you. Our small family run company would be nothing without all of you, and your constant support and encouragement on this adventure! we cant wait for the next one, and to see you all again.
Grim Workshop Is Back, and Better Than Ever!
Hey everyone! Were so glad to announce that all orders are in route and on their way to you all!

With the final hours of our first kickstarter campaign ticking down we can’t help but think of all the different pieces that had to fit together to get us to this point and we can’t help but share our excitement with everyone we see. This campaign has been successful far beyond our hopes. Thank you, to every person who has pledged, who has told their friends, made suggestions, or just sent us their best wishes. None of this would have been possible without each and every one of you, and our family will always be thankful to you for that. We take great pride in what we do, and we spend so much time thinking, designing, and producing these tools for all of you. Our international support has far exceeded our expectations. It’s always so exciting to see someone from across the world take an interest in our tools and imagining those items traveling the world, and taking part in someone’s adventures. This was our very first Kickstarter campaign, so thank you all for being so patient and kind as we learn what we’re doing. We plan on releasing another Kickstarter in the upcoming new year and are very excited because the success of this campaign will allow us to do that even faster. If any of you have any suggestions for future projects please don’t hesitate to share them, most of our tools begin with a suggestion from the people who use them. It is exciting to watch every time our tools take a new step into the world, they have come far from their humble beginnings on a family farm, and at a local farmers market in Texas, and none of that would be possible without each of you. Every pledge made has helped make our dreams come true to create Unique, functional tools for all people and all walks of life.

campaign.story:
Thank you for visiting our Kickstarter.  
We are in the final stages of our campaign, and it's been an amazing response.  Your support is sincerely appreciated folks!

The book is with the publisher, and in the final editing phase before going to print.  We will keep you updated as the printing process starts.  Many thanks again to everyone who has supported us so far!
Welcome to the world of John T. Draper, better known as Captain Crunch, the original "Phone Phreak". From his early days of facing off against Ma Bell to his current role in public speaking and privacy advocacy, it’s hard to overstate his impact on the world of technology. Along the way, he developed some of the most influential tools of the computer revolution, from the first working word processor in the seventies to the first effective firewall in the nineties. The road hasn’t always been smooth, however, and for every success there have been setbacks and hurdles of literary proportion. Let’s just call it Draperism. 
This "warts and all" biography features Draper's own telling of stories from the past fifty years, as well as commentary and other memories from his long-time friend and collaborator. It is the story of an eccentric genius who went from being a penniless hacker to a millionaire and back again, a man so consumed by his vision that the real world around him has always played second fiddle. Featuring a foreword by Apple co-founder Steve Wozniak and cameos by the who’s who of early computing, this Kerouacian journey gives us an inside look at the birth of modern computing through the eyes of one of its most influential pioneers.
Now we are in the full campaign, and after the first week of Early Bird support, the 2600 Club Bronze level is still available, and we've unlocked all the other levels. Add-ons can be added at checkout at the end of the campaign.
2600 CLUB
Early bird backer level carried forward to the full campaign
2600 Bronze: Ebook; Vector of book artwork; VIP website access
   
EASYWRITER CLUB
Signed, soft-cover copy of the book; Vector image of book artwork
  
HOMEBREW CLUB
Signed, hard-cover copy of the book; Vector image of book artwork
  
CRUNCHBOX CLUB
VIP will include access to downloadable book art, deleted sections and more.
  Exclusive Blue Box styled Collector box with a signed soft-cover copy of book; Vector image of book artwork; Exclusive replica of the infamous whistle; Mouthpiece Bookmark; VIP website membership
    HACKERS, HEROES AND DRAPERISM
This level is a replacement for our ‘Old School Hackers’ level. It contains an exclusive, limited edition (50) ‘DRAPERISM’ T-Shirt, signed by Crunchman and numbered (e.g. 4 of 50). This level gives a nod to the early Hackers Conferences, with a sly wink to those who know the Crunchman.
Exclusive Blue Box styled Collector's Box; Signed, hard-cover book; Limited edition ‘DRAPERISM’ T-Shirt, signed by Crunchman and numbered (eg 4 of 50); Replica Whistle; Blue Box Earpiece Bookmark; Vector of book artwork or 2600 poster; VIP website access
      SUPERPHREAK CLUB
The SuperPhreak Club is the ultimate backer support level, but obviously intended as a group support level. You get TEN of each item found in the Blue Box Club, plus a 1 on 1 with The Crunchman himself. This is also absolutely transferrable. The 1 on 1 can either be, you coming to meet Crunch, or Crunch coming to you. So, you can band together with a bunch of your buddies, or if your philanthropy hat is on, you can purchase this tier for an underfunded group or project.
YOU CAN CHOOSE how to use this tier.
Some ideas from us:
(1) You and some buddies pitch in and get this reward level. Each of you gets schwag, and Crunch can come to you for a meet and greet.
(2) You back this level and donate it to the local community college IT department, or local non profit, and they can set up a Crunch related event. Sell tickets! Have a Party!
(3) You back this level yourself, go to Vegas, have dinner with Crunch, maybe see a show, etc. Then give away/sell/donate all extra items to local groups you think need to know about Crunch. (or you keep it all for yourself!)
And there's more! For our Kickstarter we've created some additional goodies that will not be found anywhere else. T-shirts, posters and our extra little exclusives are available as add ons.  As we are using BackerKit, you can add these items, and manage your add-ons after the Kickstarter is finished.
*Disclaimer: Actual items may vary slightly based on stocks and supplies from manufacturers.
T-Shirts
T-Shirts: 'Phreak', 2600 and Old School 'HACKERS' - $25 each
Prints
18" x 24" Book art prints, printed on premium semigloss (170gsm): Book cover and 2600 - $20 each | Bookmarks - $1
 Book bags
Jute book bags: 'Phreak' and 2600 - $18 each
Extras
Black Anonabox Pro - $85 | VIP Membership - $10 | Exclusive replica of the infamous whistle - $8
   Level Specific Stretch Goals
If we sell out of the Blue Box level we have a one on one zoom conference.
Financial Stretch Goals
$26,000: Everyone gets a signed thank you letter from Mr Draper.
$52,000: Everyone gets interactive pdf that links parts of the book to corresponding anecdotes, photographs and materials on the VIP section of the website.
$78,000: Unlocks a 'udemy' style seminar with Mr Draper.
$104,000: Unlocks a book signing event in Las Vegas with Mr Draper and special guests.
For those of you who don’t know who Mr Draper is: John Thomas Draper (aka Captain Crunch) was an early pioneering developer at Apple Computer, in the mid to late 1970s. Among other things he developed the 'Charlie Board', an early version of a PC modem predating the DC Hayes modem. He also wrote the first word processing program, EasyWriter, for the Apple II and beat Bill Gates to the punch when it was bundled with the first IBM PC.
In the decades that followed Mr Draper worked with various notable people. In the 1980's he worked on Advanced 3-D Graphic Design Systems at Autodesk. In the 1990's he developed a revolutionary computer security system, considered un-hackable at the time.
Before all of that, he was an outlaw. In the early 1970's he was one of the 'Phone Phreaks', a group of enthusiasts who found various ways to hack the phone company and get free calls. Mr Draper became the most infamous member, and taught a lot of other people what he knew. He introduced Steve Wozniak and Steve Jobs to the ‘Blue Box’, the device he used to perform some of his crimes. Steve Jobs is quoted as saying that without the Blue Box, there would be no Apple Computer. Mr Draper was hunted by the FBI for years, and went to prison three times.
In the last decade he has toured the world, telling his story, and speaking publicly about security flaws in telecommunications, online privacy, and encryption.
The Narrative
This book recounts stories from my years of knowing John T. Draper personally, interspersed with collected memories from his friends and relatives, and John’s personal history in his own words. It spans his 74 years on the planet, and my 22 years of knowing him.
I have been John's roommate several times, business partner, and close friend over the years. I have always considered him a very interesting case for character study, and an unfathomable wealth of complexities and paradoxes.
I hope to have portrayed him in an honest but affectionate light. A balanced portrait of the incredible story that is his life.
- Craig Wilson Fraser
John T. Draper & Craig Wilson Fraser, Spain, 2015
  The Foreword
The foreword to the biography was written by renowned inventor, electronics engineer and programmer Steve Wozniak. Mr Wozniak, along with Steve Jobs, co-founded Apple Computer. Mr Wozniak has worked with Mr Draper a few times over the years, and has remained a long standing friend and ally.
John T. Draper & Steve Wozniak, 2004
   The Excerpts
Childhood anecdote by brother, Ron Draper
There was this ‘mom and pop’ super market at the end of Edith St. in Petaluma, called 'The A & B market'. It had light bulbs and licorice. John wanted bulbs. PR-2’s, PR-4 flashlight bulbs, and batteries, but as usual we had no money. Our mom would not concede to John’s wishes this time (these 'wishes' turned into outright demands when he became a teen), so we resorted to theft.
I can honestly say it wasn’t my idea. We had never stolen anything up to this point. I think I was blackmailed actually, but my dim memories don’t have the details. We thought we would use my calm demeanor and appointed me to actually steal most of the stuff. So, I was the one caught by the store manager as we were walking out.
We were asked to empty our pockets. I don’t remember what John had, but my pockets were loaded. I mean really loaded. 110v light bulbs, Christmas tree light bulbs, flashlight bulbs, AA batteries for my pen light (well, I thought, while I’m at it). I remember the store clerk adding up all the charges and it came to quite an amount.
John and the Phone Phreaks
I got a phone call from someone calling himself Denny San Jose, who told me he knew about various methods of making free phone calls. He also said there was this whistle that blew the magic tone that disconnects long distance calls, and that he had a spare. He asked me if I could drive him to San Francisco so he could show me how it worked.
---
I began to realise there was more to these guys than I first thought. They were a connected and organized group, and seemed to be inviting me to join. When the discussion got around to our trip to Burlingame, we talked about what my ‘handle’ should be. Most people had just chosen their first name and city, like ‘Denny San Jose’ or ‘Bill from New York’. Well, ‘John San Jose’ was already taken, so I said ‘how about Captain Crunch?’
The first bust
I suspected the FBI knew about me even before the Esquire article was released, but I had no idea how much they wanted to collar me. Up to that point all they had was the name Captain Crunch, but no way of finding out who I actually was. Most of the blind kids didn't know my phone number, and those who did had no need to write it down, but of course eventually I made the mistake of giving my number to the wrong person.
---
I made sure that I had removed all of my 'forbidden equipment' from my car, and stashed it in my gym locker. I took a non-working Blue Box out of my locker to take home and fix, put it in the back of my car then started the drive home. I stopped at a 7-11 to get a soda. I parked in a small parking lot next to a middle school, and just as I got out of the car, four FBI agents swooped down on me, handcuffed me, and read me my rights.
Lompoc Prison
In the 70's and 80's, they called Lompoc a Country Club. It was even home to Nixon's sleazy Watergate lawyer for a while, as well as many other celebrity prisoners. Contrary to popular lore however, it did not have a swimming pool, but it did have a nice gym, tennis courts, and Volleyball courts. I’m not sure that it still has those facilities these days. Apparently the whole place was turned into a medium security prison in the 90s, with proper fences and razor wire.
---
After a few weeks I was promoted to landscaping. It mainly consisted of cleaning. My supervisor was a guy named Easton. I used to watch this guy while I was outside cleaning his windows. He had this habit of sucking on his walkie-talkie 'rubber duck' antenna. I'd giggle as I imagined him as a suckling baby pig, wiggling his ears in pure bliss. One day I was in his office emptying his trash bin, and he got called out of his office. I couldn't believe he left me in there. I went looking through his files, but didn't find anything of much worth, then I checked out his phone to see if I could access anything outside of the prison.
John Thomas Draper - Co-author
Mr Draper is a computer pioneer, privacy advocate, and public speaker. He rose to prominence in the early phone phreaking movement of the 1970's before working on some of the most ground-breaking projects of the emerging computer era. He has lived in several US states and travelled extensively, often for months at a time. He currently lives in Las Vegas, Nevada, and is involved with various projects concerning privacy, piracy, and security.
Craig Wilson Fraser - Co-author and editor
Mr Wilson is an author, artist and graphic designer. He has been close friends with Mr Draper for over twenty years, and they have enjoyed many adventures together. Originally from the United Kingdom, he spent several years in the United States and currently lives with his family in southern Spain.
We are keeping this as simple as possible. Six tiers of backer support with six simple reward packages. There is a support level for every budget.
For early bird backers there are Ebooks, pre-released ahead of our publishing date. If you pledge the second tier of $20, you’re basically pre-ordering a first-edition signed paperback copy of the book. At the other end of the spectrum for the most devoted Crunch fans, there are some very special rewards, including some 1-on-1 time with Mr Draper himself.
The funds raised in the Kickstarter will be used towards printing and shipping your book. The books will be printed by Friesen Press in Victoria, Canada, shipped to our authors to be signed, and then sent for distribution to our US base.
The funds will also be used to pay for the costs incurred in producing the rest of the backer support level items. Every time we exceed one of our goals, we've added stretch goals in order to provide each backer with more and more value to their backer kit.

When this campaign ends on December 5, all backers will get a final check out survey sent via email. We'll collect your shipping/fulfillment information. campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Well, in all honesty, we are novices at Kickstarter. But please don't let that worry you! We have conferred and consulted with the best of the best. Experienced crowd funders and people at the top of their fields. Because this has been a labour of love for the whole team and nobody's taken a salary, we've done the best we can with what we have. That said - we think we've planned it out pretty good along the way.

Possible obstacles:

Getting the book done. 

To address this, we decided not to even start the Kickstarter campaign until we were on the last step before actual publishing/printing. We chose to wait until all the writing was done, and nearly all the editing. By the time the KS launches, the last editing process will be nearly complete (if not already complete) so the only thing left will be the logistics of printing set up and detail. Then, when the KS is finished, we will have numbers and can print pretty much immediately, which greatly shortens the process for you - our backers. Of course, there could be some unforeseables in there, but we've built some padding into our timeline.

Backer reward fulfillment delays:

Let's face it, sometimes things happen that are out of our control. We've done everything in our power to identify reliable vendors where we have to rely on outside vendors to produce items for us. We've mapped out lead times, and kept fulfillment to digital formats and within our control as much as possible. 

We've finalized our designs, mocked up our rewards and completed every process aside from pulling the trigger on order amounts. 

Of course we'll keep you all apprised if anything beyond our control occurs, but we think we've darn near thought of everything and anticipate being right on track.

What if you don't get funded?

We think we've set a pretty reasonable funding goal, so we don't think that this will happen. But, if it does, then we'll still publish the book - you just won't be able to get all these awesome extras. You'll be able to buy copies on the publisher's website, when it is published and available to the public. 

We hope this does not happen, of course. We worked hard to bring you an awesome campaign and we hope you take advantage of it and encourage all your peeps to do the same thing.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
We want to start with sugar cane growing here in Tallahassee, Florida and end up with hard candy. People have done farm to table for years, as have chocolateers done bean to bar. We intend to follow this tradition with something new, taking sugar cane and making candy from it.
Lofty Pursuits has been making hard candy for some time. We had another Kickstarter several years back where we raised money to buy a collection of hard candy making equipment that was from a candy store in Cincinnati called Mullanes. We have used this equipment made between the 1860's and 1900 making candy using standard sugar.
Now we want to make candy not just using equipment from the late 1800's. But starting with sugar grown on a farm from the 1800's. Tallahassee has a historical farm that is maintained and worked as if it was in the 1800's. They still make cane syrup here, and they still cook the syrup over a wood fire.
We've worked with them since last year, and we're about to go through a second harvest and cooking to make a video about it. That's where you come in. We need your support to make this video.
This is one of a series of videos we want to make that has little to do with the candy we make. In this case we are making a video about a candy that we don't think can become a regular product. What we make will be the rewards for here. Our stretch goals are for videos that are of other folks making candy. We call this series "Travels with Greg" and not only don't they generate sales to offset the videos, but they are expensive to make. They are also the videos I enjoy making the most because I get to get out and learn or discover things. You can see the three I made here.
This project will produce one long video (expected 1/2 hour) or possibly three to four shorter videos. We need to see the footage to decide what we will be doing with this video. This does not include the stretch videos that will be additional videos. 
Part one: Harvesting sugar cane, making cane syrup.
Part two: Working with that sugar to make hard candy.
I want to Include in this video a lot of history on the machines from the 1800's we use, this will include a trip to where the equipment was used in Cincinnati, a trip to the remains of a large plantation where they have what's left of a steam powered cane juicer.
There is a lot of experimentation here that we hope to get into the video, and of course we will make some unique candy using ingredients grown here in the Tallahassee area.
If you know of us, you know of our YouTube channel, if not check it out. http://www.Youtube.com/LoftyPursuits
We have a lot of candy experience, and a lot of candy making video experience. You can check our our candy store here: http://www.pd.net
You can of course buy our regular candy here even if you don't want to pledge this campaign.
We hope you will support this investigation into the past and future of candy making
Amazing! It took about 2 hours to become fully funded, and we’re still going.
Since we have you here, and we’d love to do more, here is what we will do with extra funding. Keep in mind this is a plan, some of these things might not work out, but I really want to try. (new rewards coming soon) These goals are divided into three things, things I can't normally afford to do. 
Cool travels with greg videos, where I go around the country to find old or other cool candy makers and make candy with them
We already donate a bunch of candy every year to good causes, but I'd like to have myself and my staff make candy to donate around the country this holiday season. With this one we are looking for your suggestions where to donate the candy canes we will make, and when we have a list we approve, the backers will have a chance to vote to where we will send them.
We've traveled in 2015 to the Makers Fair in Orlando. There is no cost effective way for us to do go on the road, there events like this just can't buy enough candy to make it worth while for us to go.  Since we get regular requests to come and make candy where you are (that we can't do), we thought we'd add this as a reward. I want to ideally do four of these in the USA. Central south, Central north, North East, West coast. We are currently working out plans to be in the Austin makers fair (food permission always makes this tricky due to food contracts with the halls they have the event.) We are open to suggestions of other places to go as long as the public can come. 
Now on to the stretch goals
We will make another video in 2018, where we modify a whiskey still to become a steam distiller to distill flavors for candy making from plants. We will probably only be able to make a few ML’s of the essential oils, but I want to try and make some. If we can make enough we will make some candy out of it, if not it should still be cool going from local plants to flavor oils (I hope to do grapefruit oil from a tree in my back yard.) This uses the same techniques I described as being used in the video where we make lavender candy. If we can make enough we will try and throw in a few pieces of candy with your pledge (1 or 2 small pieces, it won’t make much oil) ave some water in it.)
DONE! $8,000
We will travel sometime in 2018 to the Hercules Candy Company featured in the No Egg Craig videos to shoot a video with them at their shop. I hope to learn about gummies and corn starch molded candy, but I will shoot whatever they are making then.
Hercules Candy and Chocolate Shop
DONE! $23,000  
    We are known for our candy canes, and every year we make candy canes for giveaways and charities. This year you can help us make and give away even more of them. We will make a four of our standard batches of candy canes (approximately 400 hand made candy canes) that we will distribute to a charity to bring some cheer this holiday season. We are researching charities that can effectively distribute these (if you know of some, let us know) we will get an “approved” list together and have our backers vote to select the one (or ones) to donate to.
DONE! $26,000
  Uncle Wiggly Wings
I will go and interview Uncle Wiggly Wings AKA the Berlin Candy Bomber at his home. I've gotten in touch with him through his daughter and arranged a shooting time early next year if we reach this goal. Colonel Gail Halvorsen was a C-54 pilot for the Berlin air lift during WWII, he was one of the first to land with supplies in Berlin after the Soviet Union started the siege on the city. He went to the fence of the air field and found kids watching the planes land, some of whom may never have tasted chocolate because they were born during the war. He passed out the candy bars he had, and the kids divided it up, but there was not nearly enough. When the chocolate ran out, they tore little pieces of the foil off and passed them around, so the kids who did not get any could just smell the candy. He agreed to drop more candy from his plane the next day. The kids asked what is plane number was, and as he did not have an assigned plane (he flew whatever they gave him for the day) he drew on his barn storming experience and would “wiggle” his wings. That night back in his barracks, he got candy bars, tied them to handkerchiefs to use as parachutes (to keep the candy from hitting the kids at 200mph), and for the next week he dropped candy daily to the kids. He was about to stop dropping the candy but his commander got wind of this, and insisted he continue because of the great moral boost it was. He dropped 23 tons of candy during project “little vittles” with the other pilots that worked with him, much of the candy donated by members of the National Confectioner's Association. One of the candy companies that supplied candy was Mullanes, that originally owned much of the hard candy equipment we use. We will to visit him, interview him, and make some candy for him, inspired by his story. His story has been documented many times, but has never covered how he got candy companies to participate and how the candy was organized. This will be documenting something new. He is currently 97, so we want to do this soon as possible.
$31,000
   We are known for our candy canes, and every year we make candy canes for giveaways and charities. This year you can help us make and give away even more of them. We will make a four of our standard batches of candy canes (approximately 400 hand made candy canes) that we will distribute to a charity to bring some cheer this holiday season. We are researching charities that can effectively distribute these (if you know of some, let us know) we will get an “approved” list together and have our backers vote to select the one (or ones) to donate to.
$34,000
We will travel to another event to make candy hopefully closer to you. We are open to suggestions for events, we just want them big enough so lots of people can come. We are currently working on the Austin Makers Fair in 2018, but we are open to other locations if you have suggestions. We hope to raise enough money to do three of these in 2018.
$39,000
  Robert Hillary King was wrongly convicted and spent 32 years in Angola prison in Louisiana, 29 of them in solitary confinement. He learned how to make pralines when it solitary confinement, by burning paper in soda cans to cook the candies and he gathered ingredients from other prisoners and guards. This is the ultimate candy hacking to figure out how to do this. Since the charges have been dropped he has been released and now makes candy that he sells on-line under the name Freelines. His autobiography is a must read (but sadly covers little in the way of candy making.) We hope to document his story, and how he discovered how to make candy in prison, and we'd like to make candy with Mr. King. 
$44,000
   We are known for our candy canes, and every year we make candy canes for giveaways and charities. This year you can help us make and give away even more of them. We will make a four of our standard batches of candy canes (approximately 400 hand made candy canes) that we will distribute to a charity to bring some cheer this holiday season. We are researching charities that can effectively distribute these (if you know of some, let us know) we will get an “approved” list together and have our backers vote to select the one (or ones) to donate to.
$47,000
We will travel to another event to make candy hopefully closer to you. We are open to suggestions for events, we just want them big enough so lots of people can come. We hope to raise enough money to do three of these in 2018. Charity events are a great start. We have some requirements.
$52,000
We want to visit a candy factory in Salem MA, we are still trying to get up with them to arrange this, so this goal may change before we hit this level if we even come close. This shop makes the oldest commercially manufactured candy in the USA. We want to make candy with them. We will flesh this out if it comes together.
$Unknown
(more to come)
I’ve been outlining this, researching this and finding people to work with for about two years. We want to trace the sugar trade to the development of the candy trade, from Haiti and the slave trade to sugar, to the Indo-Guyanese indentured workers in guyana. I want to visit both countries and shoot footage starting there, and tracing the sugar’s path up into the north east to Philadelphia, where it was processed not only into Rum to ship to England, but also to create Americas candy trade. This is why companies like Hershey’s, Wilber’s chocolates, Quaker City Chocolate, Jordon Almonds, Peeps, Mike and Ikes, Hot Tamales, Mallo Cups, and others were based there. This is also why Thomas Mills and Brothers, the company that made most of our equipment (they made it back in the late 1800’s) was based there too. It will follow the sugar up and through the great lakes to Chicago, were candy making took off, and one company was founded to fund a religious cult (The cult is gone, but his candy is still around.) Then, if I can, I want to stretch project this project to see how sugar and more specifically candy making in the modern day has still shaped culture, race relations, and candy makers. This topic has been covered in many places, but it’s role in the development of candy making has not. This will not be as cheery as most of my videos. This project should take about 2-3 years to make if funded. It is a big one folks and will require a crew, international travel, possibly another round of funding. I already have two candy historians on board to help beyond me. The final video will be released to all backers at any level free, but may be released commercially or free. I have been working on an outline for this project for two years, and I hope you find it as interesting as I do. If I don't get full funding for this, we get funding over time from other fundraising efforts.
$150,000
Reward Photos
We have been asked to show some photos of our rewards. 
Old Glory Candy
  A unicorn dropping. This is a particular nice tutti frutti one. Yours will be of a random flavor.
  Candy Canes
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
There are some risks with this, but few with the video production. We have lots of experience making candy videos, and the video is the main product. The risks are with the outcome of the candy, and we hope you all want to be part of this experiment. Like many experiments we are not 100% sure of what the outcome will be.

Cane sugar by its nature has particles in it. It could crystallize, it could burn; this is fairly unexplored territory in candy making. This is science more than an art in many ways, so we don't expect any issues. But here are the ones we can foresee and what we will do if they happen.

There will be testing time needed with this candy. And by testing, I mean making a small batch and seeing what the candy will do in a week or two. We need to test of crystallization, that we want to avoid, as well as if the candy breaks down in other ways. This will be lots of hurry up and wait. We have budgeted for that time in the dates for the rewards, but it could take longer than those dates if this happens. If this problem occurs we will keep you informed, and we will just get you your candy a bit late.

The cane sugar may crystallize in tests because it won't invert with an acid. 
Solution: We will add some invert sugar to prevent crystallization (probably a small amount of corn syrup) so your candy will be great, but it will not be only made entirely from cane syrup. Just mostly from cane syrup.

The cane sugar might not harden completely since cane syrup is more of a hydrophile than granulated sugar. This would mean the candy will be sticky. Solution: You will get a bag of sticky but yummy candy.

There is always the possibility that everything could got wrong and we have no cane syrup candy to ship. Solution: The real goal of this kickstarter is to make the video, and a video of failure is an interesting video as well. To make it up to you we will make some cool hand made candy (possibly with the word “oops” in the middle of it) so that you end up with some delicious candy. 

We will get you candy, and we expect to get you the candy you want, but we will deliver something in any event.

Risk for some of the stretch goal videos:
We want to interview a man who is 97 years old. Enough said.

We are still arranging to make sure these videos can be made.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

Because things are shipping at different times, we are sending out the survey a bit before we are ready to ship. Some surveys have been customized for certain rewards.

As of today All of the post cards are out.

I'm running behind on things, the syrup making video is shot, but we had an amazing amount of orders, and that has set back the schedule for part 1. campaign.story:
Disclaimer:  We want to make it abundantly clear to everyone that we are not affiliated with or endorsed in any way by Victorinox AG or their trademarked name Swiss Army.  The Firefly is a patent pending aftermarket accessory designed by us for use with the Swiss Army knife. 
 What is the Firefly?
The Firefly is a custom sparking-steel fire starting tool designed to work seamlessly with a large variety of Swiss Army knives.  
The Firefly is tailor made to replace the toothpick in a Swiss Army knife or tool, it is plug-and-play, and no knife modifications are required.
       Featured in:
                           Tap on the icons below to throw some sparks! #SAKFirefly
Help grow the community.  We've done the work for you, just click and share!  
                    Features.
The Firefly comes in two sizes:  
The regular Firefly - for medium and large sized Swiss Army knives.  
And the Firefly Mini - for smaller and Classic key chain style knives.   
    The Firefly is hard to lose:
The thumbnail grip on the end of the Firefly is a bright neon yellow-green, and it glows in the dark. It is highly visible both day and night. 
 The Firefly won't fall out. Even after many uses when much of it has been scraped away it still fits snugly. 
Well used, but still fits snugly in place without falling out.
The Firefly is easy to use: 
The Firefly fits easily into any Swiss Army Knife toothpick slot. 
  Fits Any Knife with a Toothpick
It also fits in Swiss Army tools with toothpicks.
The injection molded thumb grip makes the Firefly easy to remove for use.
The Firefly is easy to spark.  It's custom mixed sparking material is about twice as easy to spark as a typical firesteel / ferrocerium rod.
The Firefly is designed to be a soft sparking steel, so it can be easily used with any sharp edged tool on the Swiss Army Knife.
Any of these tools can be used to start a fire.
The Firefly throws large, long-lasting sparks so it is easy to light a variety of tinders or fuel.
The Firefly is a tested design and its stronger:
As well as being easier to spark, it is also stronger.  
We've been able to carefully tailor the sparking material mix to double the break strength of a typical ferrocerrium/firesteel mix.
On our testing rig the custom firefly sparking material measured twice as strong as conventional firesteel sparking material mixes, which means less breaking and more sparking.
The Firefly is a very capable fire starter, able to light many different types of tinder and fuel.
Light weight and takes up no space:
Using the toothpick slot as a holder for the Firefly means that no extra pocket bulk is added, and the Firefly weighs almost nothing.
No Bulky Pockets!
  Pledge With Confidence.
We will ALWAYS Deliver!
We don't just create projects on kickstarter, we help fund them too, and we know how frustrating it is to pledge for a project that never delivers.  We will never do that to our valued backers.
If you help us reach our funding goal we WILL deliver PERIOD.
  Rewards.
Just click on the reward you want from the column at the left, enter the pledge amount and hit continue.  
If you want more you can add that to your pledge amount.  
For example: If you want the Firefly 8 Pack Early Bird reward, but you also want a Firefly Mini 3 Pack, just select the Firefly 8 Pack Early Bird reward and add in the additional amount of the Firefly Mini 3 Pack. You can tell us exactly what you pledged for once we send out your backer survey.
How many should I get?  We recommend at least two per Swiss Army knife; one for practice and use, and one for a backup. 
                                       Stretch Goals.
$60,000 UNLOCKED! :  Optional Ivory / Glow Top (original SAK toothpick color)
Ivory / Glow
Backers who pledged for the $10, $14, $18 levels will be able to choose all of one color or all of the other, no mix and match will be available for these pledge levels.  
Backers who pledge $30 and $35 will have a choice between all of one color or half one color and half the other color. No custom mix and match at this level.  
Backers who pledge $55 or more can mix and match the colors and sizes they want.
Timeline.
2009 - Idea, early prototypes.
2012 - Stronger materials testing and development begins.
2015 - Discussions begin with suppliers.
2016 - Special tooling ordered to produce sparking steels.
June 2017 -  Production samples of Firefly arrived and tested
August 2017 - Discussions with US production manufacturers for injection molding.  
September 2017 - Manufacturer chosen.  Kickstarter project begins. Plastic injection molds designed.
October 2017 - Kickstarter funding period.
November 2017 - Production begins on Firefly tooling
December 2017 - Production starts on first run of the Firefly.
January 2018 - Rewards shipment begins.  
  Meet The Team.
  The more backers we get, the better Firefly can become.  
If you'd like to help grow the Firefly community and spread the word please tap on the buttons below and share with your friends.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
We are well aware of the challenges that manufacturing can present and we are ready, willing, and equipped to meet those challenges. We've got grit! 

SOL Water, our previous project, was a success, and it taught us a great deal more about manufacturing than we knew before we started that campaign. 
SOL Water was a very complex project. We were able to develop and produce a new kind of plastic, make 3 different complex production lines of tooling, design and manufacture several injection molded parts, ship all of our product to our warehouse from overseas, and deliver all of the rewards to our backers, all on a very tight budget.
So, we've been around the block. You can check out the amazing SOL Water project and a link to purchase the product here:
https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/740457940/sol-water-hydration-powered-by-the-sun
And our website here: www.tortoisegear.com

The Firefly is a less complex project and we've done our homework. We are working with much more communicative suppliers, so there will not be long silent times. Our chosen final production manufacturer is in the USA within easy travel distance from our office if face to face communication is needed.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_userinfo: New accessory for Firefly and new SAK fire starting option going live tomorrow!
updates.update_content:
New Kickstarter campaign starting tomorrow 3/3/2020 @ 8am PST!
Set your alarms!
Hello everyone!  We hope you are all doing well and enjoying your Firefly fire starters!  This may be repeat news for some of you who are on our email newsletter list, but we wanted to make sure all of you get the update.

Hi everyone,
It's spring time and the Fireflys are out!

Hi everyone,  
Thank you to those who have received the Firefly and left honest feedback on the comments page for others.  
For those who have not received yours yet, we do apologize again for the delay.  We did have to wait in queue again for the third batch of Firefly's to be completed which has set us back a couple of weeks behind to finish fulfilling rewards.

Hello everyone, shipping has begun!
We are excited to announce that today we have started shipping out January rewards!

updates.update_userinfo: Firefly is in Production / Shipping Starts Next Week!
updates.update_content:
Hello everyone.  Here is just a quick update to let you know what's going on:
What's happened since the last update?
Since the last update we have completed the necessary mold modifications and we have done a couple of test runs.  The shape and finish of the Firefly tip is great and the Firefly rods are also no longer breaking while being molded.  The Firefly mold is ready for full production.

Happy new year everyone!  
We know many of you are eager for the Firefly to start shipping out and we have been doing our very best to meet the estimated start ship date of the end of this month.  Up to this point everything has gone according to plan and we have been on time.  However, during final sample production we encountered a couple of problems that will take a little extra time to remedy.

Happy holidays everyone!  
We wanted to send out just a quick update to let you know that we have sent out the backer surveys and our production schedule is still on track.
Surveys
