campaign.story:
Hello from Liverpool !
Hello folks and welcome to our very first Kickstarter!
We are Granby Workshop and the reason that we’re all gathered on this beautiful page is to introduce and launch our newest product range.
 SPLATWARE is a range of multicoloured ceramic tableware developed by us and our buddies Assemble.
Beautiful plates and cups are made by squashing together coloured clays in a 60-tonne hydraulic press.  Each one is different.
They’re being launched exclusively on Kickstarter. If we meet our target we can put them into production - giving you beautiful one-of-a-kind tableware and us the opportunity to expand and continue investing in our neighbourhood.
Who we are
Granby Workshop is a Liverpool based manufacturer of architectural ceramics, founded by Turner Prize winning design collective Assemble. The Workshop was set up as part of an effort to rebuild Granby, a Liverpool neighbourhood that was nearly made derelict by decades of poorly-planned regeneration initiatives.
A resourceful, creative group of residents started to bring the neighbourhood back to life by clearing, planting, painting, and campaigning. And in 2011 they entered into an innovative form of community land ownership to secure empty houses, and renovate them as affordable homes – bringing in Assemble to help. 
The project won the Turner Prize in 2015. It received a lot of press attention and you can read more about it in The New York Times, The Guardian, The BBC, Creative Review and more
The first range of products by Granby Workshop were designed for the houses being renovated: bathroom tiles, door handles and fireplaces. They reflected the care, value and creativity invested in these homes, and are now even held in the permanent collections of the V&A and the Crafts Council.
Now we want to introduce new products to help grow the workshop and expand the team. You’ll get beautiful one-of-a-kind tableware, and we’ll be able to keep producing exciting new products, and investing in Granby.  
The Products
We’re beginning a foray into an exciting new manufacturing process with a pair of products: a plate and cup. This is our very first range of tableware and it’s a nod to the social side of the community that we’re in.
It’s also part of an effort to scale up our approach – one that began by researching and tracking down RAMBO, our 60 tonne RAM Press. With this new tool, we want to combine our craft mentality with more industrial processes, in order to really push the limits of what we can create.
These are plates and cups for eating and drinking together, produced in sets, with each set showing the variety of patterns produced through the SPLATWARE process.
They are playful & celebratory, perfect for special occasions but durable enough for everyday use!
SPLATWARE #1 : Cup
Suitable for hot and cold drinks. This isn’t a teacup, a mug, a goblet or a chalice. It is a cup, as simple as it comes. Just about the right size for most things you’d like to drink. It comes in one size (8oz) but many different patterns and colours. Cheers !
SPLATWARE #2 : Plate 
A circular, 25cm diameter glazed ceramic plate. Suitable for all kinds of tasty meals. 
The Finish 
The effect created by combining these multi-coloured clays is reminiscent of Agateware or Nerikomi ceramics. Like these traditional craft techniques, the patterning is not a glaze effect or transfer – the clay itself is coloured through the body, giving a unique depth of colour and finish.
The pieces are glazed and fired to vitrification temperature at 1250 celsius, meaning they are completely food, dishwasher & microwave safe. They are durable enough to be kept as family heirlooms for generations to come.
The first edition of splatware is exclusive to Kickstarter and all products will be stamped. As well as being functional objects, you could see them as affordable art pieces - perfect as a gift or a keepsake, and who knows, one day they might even be collectible.
Splatware is made using a process that captures an element of chance in the act of making, so they’re all unique. Exact colours and patterns will be something of a surprise. 
 How they're made
To stoneware clay, we add varying amounts of ceramic pigments. Separate pieces of the colorful clays are placed together in a mould and compressed with 60 tonnes of pressure. This mixes and bonds the different colours together and forces the excess moisture out of the clay. 
The pieces are stamped, de-moulded, dried, carefully trimmed and cleaned before their first kiln firing to 1000 degrees. They’re then sanded, glazed and re-fired to 1250 to reach full hardness. It’s a blend of precision craft and backyard science that has taken a great deal of trial and error to perfect.
Why do these products matter?
Ceramics has been integral to the development of our cultures. From tools for cooking and eating to the production of durable building materials, its history interweaves the functioning of our daily lives with the development of industry.
The potters wheel was one of the first man-made machines, and in the 18th & 19th Century, ceramics became one of the first highly industrialized processes. In Stoke on Trent, Wedgewood and others pioneered factory-line models of production, based around singular, highly repetitive tasks. Speed, repetition and consistency. Every product produced exactly the same. This is more or less how most mass-produced ceramics are still made, except that with the globalization of manufacturing it largely happens in other parts of the world.
We’re interested in a different model of production, one in which chance and creativity are introduced to the production line, so that products remain enjoyable and challenging to make, and the outcomes are always different. We also believe that our business should be community-orientated - about developing and sharing skills and facilities in our neighbourhood.
Granby Workshop Wares
Importantly, this model is not just about how things work behind the scenes – it’s about creating products which have a diversity and beauty which isn’t possible using conventional manufacturing techniques. Every product is different.
What have we done so far?
Splatware began by researching and tracking down RAMBO, our 60 tonne RAM Press. It is no spring chicken - we bought it from a ceramics factory in Stoke-on-trent, where in a past life it was producing fine bone china sweet and biscuit trays. Weighing in at 5000kgs it’s a beast, so much so that it broke the floor of the factory that it was removed from.
Milan Mini Living - Test plates
Before arriving in Granby, Rambo went on a test run journey to Milan to be part of Milan Design Week where, with the support of A/D/O we first began developing the techniques that have evolved into Splatware.
Back in Granby, we extended the workshop to make room for RAMBO, and have undertaken countless tests and experiments with different clays, stains and techniques to develop a method for making SPLATWARE that retains its coherance as a set of tableware but allows for variety and experimentation in each individual piece. With our first set of moulds made we’ve produced a full batch of prototypes, allowing us to test our initial designs and run through the full production cycle. Having done this, we’ve adjusted and improved the designs to work better with the physics of the ram-pressing process and now we’re ready to get production moulds made. 
Why are we on Kickstarter?
Your support will mean that we can make you beautiful products and we can continue to invest in our neighbourhood.
We’ve already invested a lot in this new process, and we need a large order to be able to go into production and to be able to sell the products at a reasonable price. We’ll be able to buy materials in bulk, commission high quality production moulds and continue to invest in the workshop to expand our capacity for the future. This will include allowing us to install a larger kiln, drying racks and most importantly, to train new staff.
We’re a creative, community-orientated business. By supporting our campaign you are helping to launch an exclusive range of products that have been developed and made in Granby.
Each set will be made to order, by us, for you and they’ll all be different. We hope they serve you well for many meals to come !
Thank you !
Granby Workshop & Assemble
Timeline
We won’t compromise on quality, and since we won’t know the level of demand until the campaign ends, we’ve set realistic dates to avoid disappointment. We know some of these dates seem long, but quality comes first and we would rather surprise you with early delivery then risk not meeting your expectations.
9th September – 5th October – Kickstarter Campaign
October: Order materials, manufacture production moulds 
November: Fit production moulds, Batch-mix clay with pigments. Begin production run
December: Continue production. Bisque firings.
January: Sanding, glazing & re-firing.
Feb: Packaging and shipping of orders.
Limited edition splatware print by Sumuyya Khader
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Producing ceramics always has an element of risk: items can break and batches can face setbacks due to glazing errors, and machines can malfunction mid-production. We have come to realize that setbacks can happen, but having produced a full prototype batch of products from start to finish, we’re confident that we’ve ironed out the lions share of these issues. Anything that we encounter along the way, well that’s always part of the journey but we have a great team and we’re in no doubt that we’ll be able to deal with it. It’s a step up in our production methods but that’s part of the challenge and why its worthwhile.

If the campaign really takes off, some of you may have to wait a little longer for your products since we have to make each of them individually and we have a limited production capacity. We’ve tried to be conservative with our timeline and we’ll keep you fully updated along the way and promise that your unique, one-of-a-kind splatware cups and plates will be well worth the wait.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_userinfo: The curse of the final plates!
updates.update_content:
Hello!
Hello and welcome to a much overdue update on all that is Splatware.
It has been all go in Liverpool these past few months and the team has been working round the clock on final production and the all-important dispatching of orders.
PLATES PLATES PLATES PLATES PLATES PLATES
Hello and welcome to update number 9 on our Splatware voyage !

Hello all, Happy New Year and welcome to another splat-packed update. A lot has happened since our last update in November, when our first production mould arrived in Granby. First and foremost, the mould was fitted and splatting of the plates commenced!

updates.update_userinfo: Technicians day out - Same as you say
updates.update_content:
Hello all, we are back with another update on all things Splatware! 
Whilst we’ve been busy mixing clay, down the road in Stoke, our new production moulds are being made. We started by 3D printing a new master model of our plate  - adjusting the weight and profile slightly from our first set of prototypes. We've also included our potters mark on the back using the beautiful new font designed for us by Fraser Muggeridge
We took these to Andy, our mould maker who has the wonderful task of going from the model to a new set of production moulds for Rambo, our trusty Ram Press.

Hello all and welcome to the very first Splatware production update. 
Thanks to all 808 of you we get to go into production, oh yes Splatware is happening. The whole team are incredibly grateful for all of your support over the past few weeks we literally couldn't have done it without you. Honestly behind those plate faces are some beaming smiles.

updates.update_userinfo: The Block, The Case & The Die
updates.update_content:
Hello all,
What an amazing 26 days it has been. We are absolutely made up to tell you all that we've surpassed our target and yesterday we hit £70k. A huge thank you to all 768 of our wonderful backers, it's because of you all that we can go into production with Splatware. 
We are incredibly exciting here in Liverpool to start production on all of your lovely plates and cups and we will be sure to keep you updated on the process as we journey through each stage.

campaign.story:
Hi,
First thing first WHY WE ARE HERE ? 
The answer is simple, we are here to revive our's 2,300 years old craftsmanship of Pakistan's knife making industry by introducing our Traditional Handcrafted Pieces of arts . The cutlery cluster of Wazirabad is recognized all over the world for its traditional designs, unique products, high quality, hand-made products such as hunting knives, pocket knives, daggers, swords, axes, military knives, utensils, table cutlery, household and light industrial products.
Wairabad - The City Of Cutlery
 In Pakistan the cutlery industry has not experienced technological evolution and thus has not benefited from the economies of scale. The industry comprises of small and medium scale industries. This sector has been facing great challenges particularly from China, India and Taiwan which have grabbed a large chunk of Pakistan’s export market. The declining trend in cutlery export has been due to a rise in petroleum and diesel prices. The rise in prices of oil has further increased the input cost of the industry and made it difficult for them to survive in the international market
  Damascus
Traditional Damascus steel, also known as Pattern Weld, Damascene, or Damast, was first produced over two thousand years ago. Damascus swords and knives dominated the weapon industry from the Iron Age to the Viking age. Alexander the Great was said to have had a Damascus sword, and even Aristotle commented on the high quality of the Damascus steel blade. Damascus steel was the name that the Crusaders gave to the steel that they had witnessed slicing through their own, lesser quality swords, cutting the sword in half in a single swipe without ever losing its edge. The next swipe would do the same to the body of that less fortunate Crusader.
KHANJAR
Project by :
  YOUR CONTRIBUTION
I am introducing finest piece of arts from our family business back in Pakistan (Wazirabad) DK-Cutlery. This is the first time where we are going to introduce our products directly to end users, instead of going through a retailer.
Main focus of this project is to :
1-To introduce our traditional handmade designs on an international platform directly to the customer.
2-Keeping the prices minimum I want to win this project & desire to send our products all across globe so our craftsman gets the credit they deserve for making such beautiful handcrafted products.
3-We are expecting to expand our production buying new tools , nothing fancy just some basic tools to increase our production & providing better support to craftsman through better tools.
WHATS FOR YOU IN IT ?
Well , If you support us we won't let you down.
First you are going to get one of ours Beautiful handmade high quality  knife. Believe me you would love the first sight of it.
Second you save the retailer cost & save your money so it would be win win situation.

www.dkcutlery.com
QUALITY STANDARDS
Our Damascus blades are made from high quality non-stainless steels which rival or exceed any Damascus blade made from the 10 series with 4340. Our Damascus combination has taken years to perfect and has been tested under a variety of application which will offer professional performance in categories of toughness, strength (lateral stress) and edge honing and holding ability. In a 5 spot Rockwell test our blades will average near or close to 58 which offers a perfect balances between its toughness and strength. Our blades due to carbon content need to be regularly treated with wax and/or 3 in 1 oil to maintain its superior quality.
Tips to Care knife
1. NEVER STORE YOUR KNIFE FOR LONG TIME IN LEATHER SHEATH. LEATHER CAN ABSORB WATER, WHICH WILL RUST THE KNIFE.
2. ALWAYS CLEAN THE BLADE AFTER USING WITH OIL OR WAX.
PRECAUTIONS
Our Tools are very sharp so open and use them very carefully We are not responsible for any injuries associated with the use of our tools.
Disclaimer
We are not responsible for any injuries associated with the use of our tools. Our products are intended for legal use only by responsible buyers. Therefore, we will not sell our products to anyone under the age of 18. Before bidding please check your country laws as some countries Custom don't allow this. If your purchase is held by Custom Authorities in your country/State we will not be responsible for that and no refund will be issued.
Shipping
Due to region regulations we are not able to ship to Israel . This is beyond our control and we apologize for this inconvenience. Shipping Service: We Normally use DHL & FEDEX

campaign.story:
The Futurist Co. Secret Society Membership will give you unlimited access to the mysterious new toy company located in Chicago, IL. We intend to rediscover the way toys used to be made with a futuristic twist. Technology has taken over the toy industry and most new toys that are introduced these days are all digital. It's time to get back to beautifully crafted, eye pleasing, physical toys where people of all ages can play with, cherish, collect, and hand down to their children.
As a member, you will receive:  
Official Futurist Co. Secret Decoder 
Official Membership Card 
Official Futurist Co. Lapel Pin 
Official Golden Certificate
The Futurist Co. Secret Decoder is the official decoder used to unscramble all of Wilbur Wonder's secret words of wisdom to all members. Wilbur is a time traveler who wants to share his knowledge with you. You can find all of his stories on www.thefuturistco.com under Wilbur's blog. He will also have live podcasts which will broadcast on the site as well. It is extremely dangerous for Wilbur to speak of his travels and so he uses encrypted messages for safety.
The Futurist Co. Secret Decoder Copper Front. The front side of the decoder is where you decode all of Wilbur's messages. Wilbur will give all members a number to set their decoders to in order to reveal his secrets. You turn the inner dial to the set number and start deciphering his message letter by letter until it comes together! Once decoded, you can ponder Wilbur's mysterious words and interpret them on your own. These secret messages will be at the end of each blog post.
The Official Membership Card is signed and approved by Wilbur Wonder to signify that you are a part of the elite Futurist Co. Society. Attached to the membership card is the The Futurist Co. Lapel Pin. Wear your pin proud on a jacket, backpack, or bag and it will catch someone's eye.
The Official Golden Certificate. This certificate can be hung or displayed to show that you are a true Futurist! If you want to keep your membership a secret, then storing it away as a keepsake in a nice hiding spot will do as well.
The Futurist Co. introduces The Wilbur Wonder Almanac 2018-2023! Take a peak into the future with the Almanac that many would love to get their hands on! This Almanac will only be issued to members of The Futurist Co. Secret Society! DO NOT SHOW OR GIVE THIS TO ANYONE WHO IS NOT A MEMBER OF THE FUTURIST CO. That is all I can say about this book. Aren't you curious?
Who Is Wilbur Wonder?  
The mystery which surrounds The Futurist Co. is stirred up by Wilbur Wonder. He is a time traveler who visits the future from time to time (yes they are out there). You think I'm joking, don't you? I assure you this isn't some kind of stunt, and to prove it, he will speak of his travels. This type of behavior, however, is quite dangerous. You see, a fundamental rule of a futurist is to keep the memories of your travels to yourself. If the future is altered due to pre-obtained knowledge, then there will be a price to pay. As a member of The Futurist Co. you will be able to learn all of Wilbur's secrets of the future through his blog and podcast which will broadcast on www.thefuturistco.com. It is your responsibility to stay loyal to Wilbur and to all the rest of the futurists out there and keep the secrets within the society. They will be watching!
"Curiosity of the future lies deep within all of us. What a wonderful gift it would be to discover it before anyone else. I welcome you into my world to do just that."
 The Official Futurist Co. Lapel Pin and Membership Card
The Only One Of Its Kind! The "Silver" Futurist Co. Secret Decoder used by Wilbur Wonder himself!
The Futurist Co. Secret Society Decoder uses an old Roman encryption method. All members will receive a copper decoder.
 Go to www.thefuturistco.com to follow Wilbur Wonder!
You have reached the end of this campaign, you think it's a cute idea and decide to leave without joining The Futurist Co. Secret Society, but wait...
Read below:  
Time Travel Is Possible But Only To The Future  
We may be able to book our ticket to the future someday — it’ll just be a one-way trip.  
In a presentation at the British Science Festival, particle physicist Brian Cox said that time travel is possible but only in one direction.  
“The central question is, can you build a time machine? The answer is yes, you can go into the future,” the University of Manchester professor told the audience during his hour-long speech on Tuesday, according to The Telegraph. “You’ve got almost total freedom of movement in the future.”  
Cox detailed how time travel to the future is possible under Albert Einstein’s general theory of relativity. Traveling hundreds, or even thousands of years into the future, could be accomplished if someone was traveling at an incredibly fast pace, close to the speed of light.  
Discovery News equated the theory to the so-called “Twin Paradox:  
”Imagine twins, one stays on Earth (Twin A) while the other (Twin B) boards a spaceship and flies off at relativistic speeds. Compared with Twin A’s timeframe, Twin B’s timeframe will slow. If time is running slower for Twin B, then he/she will return to Earth where a lot more time has passed and Twin A has aged significantly more than Twin B. The mechanism behind this is “time dilation” and it has a stronger effect as you travel closer and closer to the speed of light. "  
Coming back from the future or traveling to another point in the past is much less likely, according to Cox.  
Relating his theory to the popular British science fiction show “Doctor Who,” Cox explained that the time-traveling Doctor would need to find a wormhole in order to return to the past. The theoretical bridge, or shortcut through space-time, proposed under Einstein’s general-relativity theory has never been proven to exist. And, even if a wormhole were discovered or created, there’s no telling whether humans could actually use it to travel through time.  
Cox isn’t the only one to theorize that a wormhole could allow time-travelers to travel backward in time. Earlier this year, astrophysicist Eric W. Davis of the EarthTech International Institute for Advanced Studies said that a wormhole would be the best option for back-in-time travel. But, Davis acknowledged, it would “take a Herculean effort to turn a wormhole into a time machine.”  
-Sara Gates, The Huffington Post

updates.update_content:
Why Hello, 
In a few days The Futurist Co. Secret Society Memberships will be patiently waiting for you in your mail boxes. Everything turned out fantastic and I think you will all enjoy the magic. Once you receive your decoders please feel free to go to Wilbur Wonder's page on www.thefuturistco.com and discover his secret messages. Also, for those lucky souls who pledged for the Almanacs please be responsible with it.

The Futurist Co. Secret Society Membership surveys are out! Make sure to fill them out soon, I plan on shipping these in two weeks time! How'd they turn out you ask? Oh baby :)
*Wilbur Wonder

Hey guys,
I have just launched my new game called Elected The Political Discussion Game! If you are interested in backing then I just want to let you know that with the $25 dollar pledge you will actually be receiving all items from all reward fields. This offer is just for all of The Futurist Co. Members so don't tell anyone!
Link:

Hey guys!
We are getting the decoders next week! Wilbur is also putting the finishing touches on the Almanac and we are still on schedule to get this beautiful package out to all of you by November! 
I am getting extremely excited for how this is all turning out!

Thank you so much for helping me bring The Futurist Co. Secret Society to life! I have so much to share with you and I don't know how to thank you guys enough! I saw a lot of very excited people give more than they needed to get us to our goal. It really was a touching experience and I will make sure to always keep you 54 backers a priority and happy to be a member. You will always have a direct line to me and I will make sure to get out some great treasures :)
Now the fun begins. I will be sending out updates as the process progresses.

You did it! I can now get started on creating my passion project and I know you won't be disappointed. I am planning on making everything as vintage and authentic as possible. I have some great secret gifts to go along with the package as well. The Futurist Co. Secret Society will be some good old fashion fun!
I am truly in awe of how loyal and excited you all are for this project and you will all be forever rewarded with some great discounts and promos for all of my new creations.

This is going to be extremely close! We are currently $238 away from funding The Futurist Co. Secret Society! I will do everything in my power to get this funded! I appreciate all of the die hard support and giving everything you can give to this project. I am creating a nice little vintage package together and it will be some great nostalgic fun receiving it in the mail just like back in the good old days. 
Check out this video for Captain Midnight's Secret Squadron from the 1950s
We are so close to hitting our goal! Please spread the word to everyone you know who would love to have a little vintage fun!

campaign.story:
Two years ago we opened the doors of our first venture Filter+Fox. From the first day the support, the love and the family of staff and customers that we have been part of has been life changing. To every one of you that has walked in through the door, Thank you.
Now, its time to do it all over again. We've secured a brand new unit in an old Laundrette on Smithdown road, south Liverpool. This area is where a lot of our staff live and we have watched it begin to come to life over the last twelve months or so.
Our new venture is currently nameless, but it will capture the laid back, continental, cafe culture thats central to Filter+Fox. On Smithdown road we will focus a little more on food with a Brunch and dinner menu served seven days a week. The same determination to serve the best produce without any of the fuss will give the South Liverpool community a space to come and relax, enjoy good wines, great food, craft cocktails and good times.
To make this new dream a reality we need your help! the fit out for the new unit will cost us approximately £60,000 and were looking to crowd fund £20,000 in exchange for lots of gifts, merch, food and drink. This funding will ensure that our venue is of a standard that befits the regeneration along Smithdown road and the standards that we expect and will deliver.
Thank you in advance to anyone of you that can become part of our journey.
big love,
Owain,  Chris and all the foxes.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The project were embarking on moves us out of the City centre environment and brings a piece of Filter+Fox to the South Liverpool community. We have enlisted the help of an amazing chef and lots of new staff to ensure our delivery is of the highest standard. obviously our industry is a risky one, but we believe that with our rich experience and proven track record along side your support we can create a really memorable venue!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
Another piece to the Bare Bones collection! 
Rick and Morty are given the x-ray treatment and zapped straight to your jacket in the form of these 30 and 40mm soft enamel pins with double clutches on reverse.
About the Bare Bones - The Book of bare bones is an ongoing series of work in which i illustrate the skeletal structures of cartoon characters. I'm now prepping for the fourth book having just successfully funded the third (An all Simpsons special).
This project is to make soft enamel pins of two awesome characters - Rick and Morty!
Here's the Itchy & Scratchy set i just produced also using kickstarter as a reference of finish on the final pins -
 Heres the tees!
 STRETCH GOAL 1 - @ £500 - Custom R & M X-Ray backing cards
UNLOCKED!
STRETCH GOAL 2 - @ £800 - Mr Meeseeks extra reward option.
UNLOCKED
STRETCH GOAL 3 - @ £1500 - Mr Poopy Butthole extra reward option.
---------------

As with all funding projects ive learnt repeatedly that production can and inevitably does go wrong from time to time, ive learnt to allow extra time.
I do however now have a long list of very trustworthy manufacturers who i now personally deal with so there should be minimal risks and issues.

updates.update_content:
So there was a little delay on the last few rewards going out, but all of these have now been posted! Again, thank you all so much for your patience and for helping me make these a reality!
I may try and do another campaign, but I'm sailing very close to the birth of my son now!
Ps: there's a few bits heading to the Rick & Morty offices, hope they dig em!
Hey all! So I've spent three days packing all your rewards and I'm about 15 away from from finishing! I'll start posting them out tomorrow! Can't wait for you guys to get them! Ta!

Hi guys, hope you're having a nice weekend! Just letting you know i am out of the country for 9 days as of tomorrow and i really hoped to get these sent before i left, but they still haven't arrived! I promise you everything will be sat waiting for me when i return and getting you your rewards will be my absolute priority!
Thanks again for your support and your patience!
WB
Who's excited!?
So I want to make picklerick X-ray pins, but I can't afford to do it right now. Shall I make a new campaign and give the option to add it to your previous rewards?

Hi everyone! So I've decided to go ahead with the stretch goal regardless of not hitting the target, basically I really want to make them!
If you'd like the mr Poopybutthole pin, just add £4 to your pledge and make sure you put a note when the surveys go out!
There'll be a few sets available after the campaign but they'll be the normal price at £6 per pin.

So were nearing the finish line and were only a few quid off the last stretch goal... Well, £74 to be precise.... So, please tell anyone you think may be interested!
Here's the finished Mr Meeseeks and the Rick and Morty drawings ready to be Soft enameled! Have a great weekend everyone!

Hi everyone, thanks again for your pledges, I'm away working so haven't been able to work on the stretch goals as yet. Hopefully have a mock up of the three and possible fourth on line by the end of the week!
Cheers all!
WB

Killer first day!
So were over the triple goal mark. Heres a wee incentive for the next.... A thfourth reward option -
MR POOPY BUTTHOLE XRAY PINS WILL UNLOCK AT £1500
Thank you!

campaign.story:
Chaffies are small, and round, with one and a half ears. They're always very happy and curious, and should you find one, it will be your friend for life. However, Chaffies do have a tendency to get themselves lost, so the aim of this Kickstarter campaign is to make finding one that little bit easier.
'FIND CHAFFY' began over ten years ago as a spoof 'lost pet' campaign. We handmade some Chaffies out of fabric and sent them across the world, asking anyone who found one to show us where they ended up. We received hundreds of sightings from countries as far and wide as:
We then collected all these sightings together on the Find Chaffy Website!
Our campaign took a new direction with 'Find Chaffy - The Book', a highly-illustrated picture book published by Scholastic (UK) and translated into a number of different languages. Since then, our ongoing search for Chaffies has grown and grown, through a variety of different mediums. From real-life treasure hunts across London, to iOS Messenger stickers, to Find Chaffy cartoons and animations such as this one...
(Animated by Birdbox Studios, Produced by Mind Candy)
Now, with your help, we're hoping to relaunch Chaffies in vinyl, and take our worldwide search to the next level!
The aim of this Kickstarter is to raise enough money to produce at least 500 Chaffy vinyl figures. Vinyl is lightweight and durable, making this new series of Chaffy perfect for taking on adventures.
Once you find a Chaffy, we hope you'll share your Chaffy photos with us across Instagram, Facebook and Twitter, and we'll regularly gather together some of the best to show on our website. There you'll be able to see all the amazing places Chaffies have been found, along with loads of fun Chaffy artwork, animations, and updates.
We've planned our Kickstarter target so, as well as the Chaffy itself, we can also offer you a load of extra Find Chaffy goodies. Later tiers include reprints of the book, a print set of the best Find Chaffy cartoons, and original artwork. We've also been careful to make sure a Chaffy is the same price for everyone, wherever in the world you are, with no hidden shipping costs (although we can't be liable for any import duties which may apply in your country).
When you find a Chaffy, this is what you get:
(All the model Chaffies shown in this Kickstarter campaign originally made by Kerry Dyer. Final versions may vary slightly. PLEASE NOTE: Chaffies are sold as vinyl figures rather than toys, and as such may not be suitable for very young children)
If you'd like to find your own Chaffy, we've prepared a number of different options for you to choose from. EVERY Chaffy comes with the extras listed in the first tier, and all prices include worldwide delivery! 
** DIGITAL SPECIAL! All tiers come with a free PDF of 'Find Chaffy - The Book', but if you want the PDF on its own you can choose this option for only £3!**
INCLUDES:
• One CHAFFY VINYL FIGURE (with sketch card, mini booklet, certificate and set of four art cards) 
• A PDF of 'Find Chaffy - The Book'.
 (Want to see which prints are in the set? Click HERE!)
INCLUDES:
• 'WHAT SORT OF MONSTER TURNS UP UNANNOUNCED?' - For the first time, ten of the most popular Find Chaffy cartoons collected as a set of square (14.5cm) prints!
• One CHAFFY VINYL FIGURE (with sketch card, mini booklet, certificate and set of four art cards)
• A PDF of 'Find Chaffy - The Book'.

 (Want to see a sample of the book? Click HERE!)
INCLUDES:
• A signed paperback copy of 'FIND CHAFFY - THE BOOK' - Find Chaffies hidden amongst rolling pandas, scaredy ghosts, angry robots, and loads more weird and wonderful pictures. 24 pages, featuring 10 incredibly detailed picture searches, and a sweet and silly story running through it all!
• One CHAFFY VINYL FIGURE (with sketch card, mini booklet, certificate and set of four art cards)
 • A PDF of 'Find Chaffy - The Book'.
INCLUDES:

• A PDF of 'Find Chaffy - The Book'.
INCLUDES:

Also includes everything from Tier 4:
• One CHAFFY VINYL FIGURE (with sketch card, mini booklet, certificate and set of four art cards)
• 'WHAT SORT OF MONSTER TURNS UP UNANNOUNCED?' - For the first time, ten of the most popular Find Chaffy cartoons collected as a set of square (14.5cm) prints!
• A signed paperback copy of 'FIND CHAFFY - THE BOOK' - Find Chaffies hidden amongst rolling pandas, scaredy ghosts, angry robots, and loads more weird and wonderful pictures. 24 pages, featuring 10 incredibly detailed picture searches, and a sweet and silly story running through it all!
• A PDF of 'Find Chaffy - The Book'.
INCLUDES:

Also includes everything from 'FRUITS' tier:

• A signed paperback copy of 'FIND CHAFFY - THE BOOK' - Find Chaffies hidden amongst rolling pandas, scaredy ghosts, angry robots, and loads more weird and wonderful pictures. 24 pages, featuring 10 incredibly detailed picture searches, and a sweet and silly story running through it all!
• A PDF of 'Find Chaffy - The Book'.
• COMMISSION YOUR OWN FULL COLOUR COMIC PAGE!  I’ll create an exclusive A4 comic page just for you. It can be about whatever you want, and, if you like, feature any of my characters. Want me to draw an exclusive Chaffy comic for you? Want me to draw you IN a comic with Looshkin? Want me to draw your kids running around with Bunny Vs Monkey? Want me to just draw a comic about a sad banana? Hey, you’re the boss!
I’ll discuss with you what you want me to do, if you have any ideas for a script, and any requests for what should appear. Then I’ll go away and write a rough script for your approval. Once approved, I’ll turn this script into a finished, colour, single-page comic (approx 9 – 12 panels).
Once complete, I’ll send you a digital version of the finished artwork, as well as an A4 colour print, and the original black and white inkwork! 
My only restrictions are that the comic must be within the bounds of taste and decency, and if it features one of my original characters or a copyrighted character then it can’t be reprinted in a publication – this is only for personal use.
I very rarely do commissions, so this is a great chance to get an exclusive, unique comic! To see more examples of my comic work, check out my site at www.fumboo.com
•  Also includes 3 Chaffies (I’ll most likely hide one in your comic too), and everything else from the TREATS tier.
(Want to see a sample of the picture search? Click HERE!)
• COMMISSION YOUR OWN FIND CHAFFY PICTURE SEARCH! I'll create an exclusive Find Chaffy picture search puzzle for you. You and I can discuss what animal/creature you want to be the theme, and also any other things you might want to hide in there - perhaps yourself, your children, your pets. Anything you like (within the bounds of taste and decency)! 
• Once complete, I'll send you a digital version of the finished full colour artwork, as well as an A3 colour print, and the A2 original black and white lineart.
• Also includes ten Chaffies (real life versions of the Chaffies hidden in your picture!) and everything else from Tier 4.
This is a very rare chance to commission such a unique and personal piece of art!
Whichever tier you choose, as long as your tier includes a physical item (such as the Chaffy figure, the paperback book, or the print set), then you can always order ADDITIONAL copies of those things. Want a load of Chaffies to hand out to your friends? Want extra books to pass onto your school? Well just add the following amounts to your total, and when our Kickstarter campaign is over we'll send out a survey asking you to confirm which extras you've ordered.
(By the way, if you've already pledged and later decide you want to add extras, you can do this at any time during the campaign by clicking 'manage your pledge' and adding the extra amount!)
Not only does every extra Chaffy you order come with its own sketch card, mini booklet, certificate and set of four art cards, we'll also include an exclusive set of FIND CHAFFY FRIENDSHIP STICKERS!
(Any tiers involving multiple Chaffy vinyl figures will also receive these stickers)
Reaching the target would be utterly incredible, and really enable Find Chaffy to become something special. However, just in case the campaign goes even better than expected, we've prepared a few stretch goals. Once unlocked, these bonus items will ship to everyone who funds at certain tiers (to be announced).
While it can be tricky with a Kickstarter campaign to work out the exact costings, we've done our best to estimate what we'll need to make this work. In fact we've slightly over-estimated, so there's enough of a buffer to cover any problems.
The £8,500 target breaks down like this:
(Please note: All amounts are estimates, and pie chart isn't to exact scale)
We'll be working with Madebycooper to produce the Chaffy vinyl figures, Comic Printing UK for the Find Chaffy books, and Awesome Merchandise for the extras - all of whom come very highly recommended in their respective industries!
I have run two crowdfunding campaigns before: The first was to self-publish a comic book, the second to raise money and send comics to Readathon. Both beat their targets, and were successfully fulfilled.
For this campaign, we're hoping to have everything ready and shipped out by the end of November this year, just in time for Christmas. Unforeseen circumstances may of course arise, but we've checked and triple-checked our schedule, our accounting, everything we can. In short: I want Find Chaffy to be appreciated by as many people as possible, so I'll be working hard to try and make sure everything happens as planned.
Hello! My name is Jamie Smart, and I've been working full-time as an illustrator for nearly 20 years. For most of that time I have been lucky enough to write and draw my own comics, including titles such as Bear, Bunny Vs Monkey, Space Raoul, Whubble and Fish-Head Steve. I created and edited the children's anthology Moose Kid Comics, released a number of childrens books, created a number of long-running webcomics, and worked extensively in TV development.
Not only that, but I've been allowed to work on other people's well-known properties too, including illustrating my own Doctor Who book (eek!), and writing and drawing such classic characters as Desperate Dan and Roger The Dodger for The Dandy and The Beano.
My full client list includes: The Phoenix, The Beano, The Dandy, Toxic, Scholastic, OUP, DFB, Random House, Cartoon Network and Disney. To see examples of my work, please check out my website.
I live just outside London, in the UK. If you have any questions for me about this project, or about anything, you can usually find me babbling on twitter -> @jamiesmart
I love creating characters and comics, and Find Chaffy has been a passion project for most of my career. Any help you can give either supporting or sharing this Kickstarter would be hugely appreciated.

updates.update_content:
Hello everyone!
This is just a super quick update to say we're having another flash sale of Chaffy vinyl figures tomorrow, Friday 5th July, at 4pm (UK time). This time around the theme is 'FOOD', and every Chaffy comes with a bundle of rather exclusive and delicious looking Chaffy food-related merch (pic below).
Also, this is the last Chaffy sale we'll be doing. So if you fancy another one for yourself, or maybe sending a Chaffy as a gift, visit: https://findchaffy.bigcartel.com tomorrow at 4pm and grab one! Or two. Or however many you like. The last sale we did sold out in just a couple of hours, so who knows how this one will go.

updates.update_userinfo: Chaffy vinyl figures now on sale, with enamel pins, bookmarks, and more!
updates.update_content:
Hello everyone!
Now the Kickstarter is all wrapped and fulfilled, and we have a brand new website with a gallery of regularly updated Chaffy sightings, we're finally ready to start selling Chaffies! They're on sale right now in our WEBSTORE (click here), and each Chaffy comes with a few new surprises...

updates.update_userinfo: The brand new Find Chaffy website is live!
updates.update_content:
Hello everyone!
We have some very exciting news to share, the brand new Find Chaffy website (www.findchaffy.com) is now live! We've worked hard to make it a big joyful squeeze of fun, art, animated cartoons and more:

I've been waiting to write this update for ages, so I'm really excited to say that we're sending out all the remaining Chaffy orders this week! Here's a peek into the Chaffy nursery as it looks right now:

updates.update_userinfo: Remaining Chaffy orders shipping out this week! + A special thank you!
updates.update_content:
Hi everyone!
Just a quick one. I try not to send out updates when there isn’t any specific news, but a few people have been asking about the remaining Chaffies so my apologies if I’ve not been keeping you updated enough.
Some backers are still waiting for their Chaffies and for that I’m sorry (and frustrated too that you’re waiting). I’ve detailed what’s been going on with our manufacturers in previous updates, but because we started from scratch with a new manufacturer, it has taken this long to get everything approved again. Please know I’m pushing as much as possible, and as soon as the new batch of Chaffies arrive I’ll send out another update, and become an absolute blur of packing and posting to get them out to you.

... we're getting closer!
Hello! Jamie here. As detailed in my previous update (January 20th), we had a bit of trouble with the manufacturer of our Chaffy vinyl figures, and as such could only send out (approx) 60% of our orders. I assigned a new manufacturer to the case, but it did mean starting from scratch (3D models, prototypes, etc etc) which pushed all my best laid plans into delay.
I now have a clearer schedule from the new manufacturer and so I wanted to update you with where we're at. This week my contact is going out to Hong Kong - where the figures are being made - to oversee the first prototype personally, and then sending it to me for approval (I imagine he was going out there anyway, but the point is, it's fantastic to have someone actually in the factory on my behalf). Once the prototype is approved, production will take about a month. So this means that all being well we should be receiving all the new Chaffies by end of April/early May. Then we'll get straight to work packaging up all the remaining orders, which'll take another week or two.

campaign.story:
An Animation Icon
Used by animation professionals and students for decades, the animation disc is an integral part of the traditional animation process. It’s become an icon for 2D animation and while there have been many iterations over the years, I chose to create a pin based on the disc most commonly used by large animation studios in the US.
The Pin
Final pin design and color callouts
The 1” hard enamel pin comes with a 2.5” x 1.75” backer card. The design is already completed and I am simply looking for the funds to order the first production run of pins.
Kickstarter backers will save $2 if they order their pin now, as they will each cost $10 after the Kickstarter has completed.
If funded, I will place the order right away and should be shipping your pins out in a matter of weeks.
Final pin design with backer card
Thanks so much for looking and please feel free to contact me with any questions or comments!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The design work for the pin is already completed and I've already got a quote from the production company, so the only risks I could imagine would be a delay in production on their end, which is not expected.

We are also expecting a baby in early August (!) so it will certainly be a busy time, but I will certainly be making this project a priority.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Hi all - one last update with a few important notes before I sign off.
At this point all orders are completed and shipped, except for three of you who I seem to be unable to contact for your address. I’ll keep trying! The rest of you should have your pins or they should be arriving very soon. International orders should start arriving this week and depending on where you’re at should hopefully be there by the middle of the month. 
If there are any issues, if you don’t receive your pins, if there are any damages, etc, please contact me and we’ll get it sorted out. You can send me a message here on Kickstarter or feel free to email me at mattdewater@gmail.com.

Hi all, after yet more struggles with the post office (pricing seems to be completely arbitrary depending on who I talk to and what mood they are in that day, which has been extremely frustrating), all 47 of my international orders are on their way! Many many thanks to all my international backers for your patience. Keep an eye out for your pins, hopefully they'll arrive quickly!
To all my US backers: If by this point you haven't yet received your pins, please contact me so we can get it sorted out. I only had one returned to sender and I've got about 3 or 4 backers who I have yet to receive an address from, but other than that everyone in the US should have received theirs by now.

Hi everyone - wanted to let everyone know that the last of the U.S. based shipments have been dropped in the mail! 
If you're in the US and haven't received your pins yet, expect to sometime later this week, or early next week at the latest. If you haven't by later next week, please contact me and we'll figure out where your order is.
The only exception is a handful of people who I never got an answer for the address survey from. I'll be messaging you directly to hopefully get that address from you.

updates.update_userinfo: An Overdue Update: Last U.S. Batch, Damages, and International
updates.update_content:
Hi everybody, sorry for the lack of updates the past two weeks. Been a busy couple weeks on top of a bit of a setback. So here’s where we’re at:
I ran into some issues with the mailers I was using jumping in price to have shipped. Apparently a new rule at the post office - brand new - is that if a package is padded inside, it has to be shipped as a “Package” rather than a “Large Envelope.” This made each one jump in price about 3x. No good.

Hi all - another shipping update! I've determined that simply using stamps (as opposed to actually taking the packages to the post office or trying to print off shipping labels) saves me quite a bit of time, so I was able to get out another batch today. 
With that, I'm only left with one more batch of about 25 orders shipping within the U.S. Then finally, the international orders will finish things off.
Getting close! Thanks for all your patience, as usual.

Hi everybody -
Another batch of pins was shipped out this morning! Unfortunately that means I still have a little over 100 orders to send out.  The ones still left are mostly orders that have multiple pins and/or are being shipped internationally, but there are a few single-pin orders left as well. The good news is I now have everything packaged and labeled and now it’s just a matter of making another 2-3 trips to the post office.  Thanks again for your patience.

Hi all - just wanted to send a note that shipments have started going out! It's a bit of a slower process than I hoped for as this is my first time doing a big batch shipment like this so I'm still kind of figuring out a good system, but I'm slowly making my way through all the orders. 
That said, the first batch has been dropped at the post office so some of you can expect to have your pins later this week! As for the rest of you, I'm splitting the rest into a few more batches and hope to have everything out within the next week to two weeks.

Hi all, exciting news! The shipment of pins has arrived and I’m really quite happy with how they turned out! See pictures below.
Over the next week or two I’ll be getting everything organized, packed, labeled, and shipped to all of you. I’ll be attempting to get everything out asap, but please bear with me as I don’t have all that much free time at home these days with our two-month-old! 
If you haven’t filled out the backer survey that was sent out last month, please do so! There are about 10 responses missing - without it I can’t ship your pins!

Hi all - just an update to let everyone know that I don't yet have the finished pins. I've received a few inquiries about whether I have shipped them yet or not - I promise that when I do, I will update again here and you will all be the first to know! Should hopefully be sometime this month.
Thanks for your patience!
Matt

Hi all - just an update to let everyone know I received the funds from Kickstarter this weekend and will be placing the order for the pins this week. 
I've also just sent out the Reward Surveys - this is where you'll provide your shipping address, so please make sure to respond to the survey so I can get your pins out as soon as they come in.
Thank you!

campaign.story:
This White Rabbit enamel pin is based on the John Tenniel illustration from Alice's Adventures in Wonderland. Since the 90s this has been my favorite book (that's the 1990s, not 1890s). In 1998 I got a tattoo just like this pin on my ankle. My mother still won't look at it. Anyway, I thought since I design pins, it was time for me to add my favorite rabbit to my collection. 
What's special about this pin?
I strive to make all my pins something unique and beautiful and this pin is no exception. Features include:
Rose gold enamel
A real gold chain connecting the pocket watch to the rabbit's pocket
Glitter accented blue umbrella
Double pin backs
Backing card with store coupon
When will it arrive?
All pins will be shipped early July when the kickstarter funds clear. That means you won't have too long to wait! Hooray!
Are these Limited Edition?
Yes, they are limited edition and will not be restocked once sold out. Kickstarter pledges get access to free shipping and discounted 2-packs.

That means they will ship to you in a little over 2 weeks. I'm really excited to see the final product and will post a photo as soon as they arrive.

campaign.story:
Keep Me! keepers are the SECUREST and most PRACTICAL ring holders available.
Keep Me! keepers unique and innovative design keeps your rings SAFE and SECURE even if they are tipped over, dropped or knocked off a surface.
Keep Me! keepers are also incredibly PRACTICAL and can be used in ALL places where rings are taken off - 
  Featuring 5 COLLECTIBLE CHARACTERS
    Keep Me! keepers are very EASY TO USE and work via a simple 'Push Fit' system. A super snug fit ensures that your rings are held SAFE and SECURE. 
  PLAY

  Keep Me! keepers are EASY TO USE
    So SIMPLE, yet so very USEFUL - Keep Me! keepers keep your rings SAFE and SECURE even if they are tipped over, dropped or knocked off a surface.
    Keep Me! keepers in the BATHROOM
  Keep Me! keepers HOLD your rings SECURELY
  Keep Me! keepers are SECURE, yes, but they are also very PRACTICAL - their compact features makes them easy to have around the home or in your bag and ready to use when you need it, after all it's not only around the HOME that you take your rings off...what about at WORK?..at the GYM?..on HOLIDAY?
      TheRingFinders.com is the leading global directory of metal detecting specialists who help people find their lost rings at beaches, parks, lakes & yards. They have recovered over $6 million of lost jewellery. Founder Chris Turner, who has been helping people find their lost rings for over 21 years, had this to say about Keep Me! keepers -
"I think your idea Keep Me! Keepers is very clever!"
"It’s amazing how many people contact us and ask if we can search their home for their lost ring...There are so many ways a ring can fall to the floor…with your product it would be easy to find!"
"I'm sure your product will do very well and hopefully reduce our calls for indoor searches as our metal detectors won't work in a house full of metal."
"There are so many ways a ring can fall to the floor"
  Keep Me! keepers can hold rings from sizes from J to T and rings up to 8mm band width or 2 rings together - engagement and wedding rings.
    Keep Me! keepers can hold 2 rings together
            Keep Me! keepers are designed by Tom Blake. Tom's background is in feature films, working as an Animatronic designer and sculptor making creatures for films such as Harry Potter, Charlie and The Chocolate Factory, Hellboy 2 and Where the Wild Things Are. Tom then crossed over into 3D animation, working in London and New York. You can see some of his previous work here
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
This is our first Kickstarter project, however we have a lot of experience in getting things made to a very high standard under tight deadlines - Tom has worked in the services industry for 16 years, designing and making both Animatronic and CGI characters for film and television.

We have a reliable manufacturer in place as well as backups should there be any problems.

Communication is key across all areas of the project and backers will be periodically informed of all developments.

campaign.story:
Hi there!
My name is Rachel, I am the doodler and illustrator behind Bird House Press and I have become obsessed with enamel pin badges! (I'm sure the only cure is more pin badges...). My first Kickstarter campaign saw two of my illustrations successful brought to life in enamel pin badge form - and now I am hooked!!
I was playing around with 'spooky' ideas and sketched a little potion bottle which instantly seemed right to be made into an enamel pin.  Starting this campaign now means that the pins will be (if funded!) produced and shipped in plenty of time to be this years most wanted Halloween accessory!! 
THE PIN DESIGN
Glow in the Dark Hard Enamel Pin Badge
The first pin will be something along the lines of the above image - with the special added feature that the skull and cross-bones GLOW IN THE DARK!!!
Glow in the dark poison potion bottle - spookily good!
This will be the first time I have used a Glow in the Dark feature on a pin - have to say I am a tiny little bit excited to say the least!
Details of the pin:
Approx. 30mm high 
Hard Enamel 
Glow in the dark fill on the Skull and Cross-bones
Coloured Rubber Clutch 
Will come affixed to an illustrated backing card
PLEDGES / EARLY BIRD REWARD LEVELS
By backing this project you will help me raise the funds to get these pins manufactured.  The majority of the goal amount covers the production of the pins, the amount that remains relates to postage and packaging costs in shipping the pins out to backers. 
For those 'Early Birds' to the campaign - there are special pledge amounts for those who support this campaign early on.  Look for the 'Early Bird pledge amount - and grab yourself 1, 3 or 5 pins at a sweet, sweet deal!
STRETCH GOALS
Stretch Goal - Luck Potion - UNLOCKED!
  I have other potion designs - that if the funding exceeds the stretch goal amounts listed above - will be 'unlocked'.  At the end of the campaign - backers will be able to choose which pins they would like from those 'unlocked' pins. The image above gives a hint as to what they will be - the design will be revealed as the campaign progresses / we get nearer to the goals!
Poison - Goal - £250 **Met in 12 hours!**
Love - Stretch Goal - £450 **UNLOCKED**
Fame - Stretch Goal - £650 **UNLOCKED**
Happiness - Stretch Goal - £900  **UNLOCKED**
Luck - Stretch Goal - £1300 **UNLOCKED**
The original two stretch goals were reached within 7 days (THANK YOU!) - so a 4th pin has now been added to the line up.  UPDATE! - The 4th stretch goal has been reached - so the 'Happiness' pin design has now been unlocked! A 5th and final stretch goal of £1300 has been set - which will unlock a 'Luck' pin.  Since this started with a 'Glow in the Dark' pin - it seemed fitting to end on one too!  **UPDATE** - this goal too has been reached - so all 5 pins designs will be availble to backers to choose from!
Once the campaign ends - backers will be able to chose from any of the unlocked pins (within the number they have pledged for).
POSTAGE
Once i have received the pins all post will be sent out UK standard class or standard international shipping for around the world. This means no tracking numbers will be available with standard shipping (although I always obtain proof of postage). 
If you would like a tracked delivery service then please don't hesitate to get in touch and I can let you know how much extra this would cost.
Want to know more about me and Bird House Press?
I'm on Facebook, and Twitter - but being a visual person my home is on instagram!! Pop by and say hello:
Twitter / Instagram: @BirdHousePress
Facebook: facebook.com/BirdHousePress
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
These pins are being manufactured for me - therefore the production process is outside of my control. Potentially we could hit delays if the manufacturer experiences any issues, hopefully not.

If there are any delays, I will keep all backers updated with any amended dates if applicable, but I have everything crossed that this will not happen!

I have communicated to my manufacturers exactly how I would like the pins to look and they have a clear understanding of the designs.

Also please note it takes 2 weeks after the project has been funded to receive the funds, therefore the pins will only go into production at this point.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
The Futurist Co. Secret Society Membership will give you unlimited access to the mysterious new toy company located in Chicago, IL. We intend to rediscover the way toys used to be made with a futuristic twist. Technology has taken over the toy industry and most new toys that are introduced these days are all digital. It's time to get back to beautifully crafted, eye pleasing, physical toys where people of all ages can play with, cherish, collect, and hand down to their children. 
As a member, you will receive:
Official Futurist Co. Secret Decoder
Official Membership Card  
Official Futurist Co. Lapel Pin
Official Golden Certificate
The Futurist Co. Secret Decoder is the official decoder used to unscramble all of Wilbur Wonder's secret words of wisdom to all members. Wilbur is a time traveler who wants to share his knowledge with you. You can find all of his stories on www.thefuturistco.com under Wilbur's blog. He will also have live podcasts which will broadcast on the site as well. It is extremely dangerous for Wilbur to speak of his travels and so he uses encrypted messages for safety.
The Futurist Co. Secret Decoder Copper Front. The front side of the decoder is where you decode all of Wilbur's messages. Wilbur will give all members a number to set their decoders to in order to reveal his secrets. You turn the inner dial to the set number and start deciphering his message letter by letter until it comes together! Once decoded, you can ponder Wilbur's mysterious words and interpret them on your own. These secret messages will be at the end of each blog post. 
The Official Membership Card is signed and approved by Wilbur Wonder to signify that you are a part of the elite Futurist Co. Society. Attached to the membership card is the The Futurist Co. Lapel Pin. Wear your pin proud on a jacket, backpack, or bag and it will catch someone's eye.
The Official Golden Certificate. This certificate can be hung or displayed to show that you are a true Futurist! If you want to keep your membership a secret, then storing it away as a keepsake in a nice hiding spot will do as well. 
 Introducing 2 fantastic rewards straight from Wilbur Wonder himself! 
The Futurist Co. Official Time Capsule is a beautifully designed pure copper pod to store all of your treasures into for future discovery. The time capsule comes equipped with a day, month and year setting in order for the next generations to unearth and enjoy. Place this capsule into the ground of a secret spot, a family home, a garden, the mountains, the desert, the forest, anywhere! This capsule was meant to create a special moment between families and friends in which they can cherish and think about for the rest of their lives. 
*If you would like more than one time capsule then please add $175 for each capsule to your pledge and notate it in your survey at the end of the campaign!
The Futurist Co. introduces The Wilbur Wonder Almanac 2018-2023! Take a peak into the future with the Almanac that many would love to get their hands on! This Almanac will only be issued to members of The Futurist Co. Secret Society! DO NOT SHOW OR GIVE THIS TO ANYONE WHO IS NOT A MEMBER OF THE FUTURIST CO. That is all I can say about this book. Aren't you curious? 
Who Is Wilbur Wonder?
The mystery which surrounds The Futurist Co. is stirred up by Wilbur Wonder. He is a time traveler who visits the future from time to time (yes they are out there). You think I'm joking, don't you? I assure you this isn't some kind of stunt, and to prove it, he will speak of his travels. This type of behavior, however, is quite dangerous. You see, a fundamental rule of a futurist is to keep the memories of your travels to yourself. If the future is altered due to pre-obtained knowledge, then there will be a price to pay. As a member of The Futurist Co. you will be able to learn all of Wilbur's secrets of the future through his blog and podcast which will broadcast on www.thefuturistco.com. It is your responsibility to stay loyal to Wilbur and to all the rest of the futurists out there and keep the secrets within the society. They will be watching!
"Curiosity of the future lies deep within all of us. What a wonderful gift it would be to discover it before anyone else. I welcome you into my world to do just that."
The Official Futurist Co. Lapel Pin and Membership Card
The Only One Of Its Kind! The "Silver" Futurist Co. Secret Decoder used by Wilbur Wonder himself!
The Futurist Co. Secret Society Decoder uses an old Roman encryption method. All members will receive a copper decoder. 
Go to www.thefuturistco.com to follow Wilbur Wonder!
You have reached the end of this campaign, you think it's a cute idea and decide to leave without joining The Futurist Co. Secret Society, but wait... 
Read below:
Time Travel Is Possible But Only To The Future
We may be able to book our ticket to the future someday — it’ll just be a one-way trip.  
In a presentation at the British Science Festival, particle physicist Brian Cox said that time travel is possible but only in one direction.  
“The central question is, can you build a time machine? The answer is yes, you can go into the future,” the University of Manchester professor told the audience during his hour-long speech on Tuesday, according to The Telegraph. “You’ve got almost total freedom of movement in the future.”  
Cox detailed how time travel to the future is possible under Albert Einstein’s general theory of relativity. Traveling hundreds, or even thousands of years into the future, could be accomplished if someone was traveling at an incredibly fast pace, close to the speed of light.  
Discovery News equated the theory to the so-called “Twin Paradox:
” Imagine twins, one stays on Earth (Twin A) while the other (Twin B) boards a spaceship and flies off at relativistic speeds. Compared with Twin A’s timeframe, Twin B’s timeframe will slow. If time is running slower for Twin B, then he/she will return to Earth where a lot more time has passed and Twin A has aged significantly more than Twin B. The mechanism behind this is “time dilation” and it has a stronger effect as you travel closer and closer to the speed of light. "
Coming back from the future or traveling to another point in the past is much less likely, according to Cox.  
Relating his theory to the popular British science fiction show “Doctor Who,” Cox explained that the time-traveling Doctor would need to find a wormhole in order to return to the past. The theoretical bridge, or shortcut through space-time, proposed under Einstein’s general-relativity theory has never been proven to exist. And, even if a wormhole were discovered or created, there’s no telling whether humans could actually use it to travel through time.  
Cox isn’t the only one to theorize that a wormhole could allow time-travelers to travel backward in time. Earlier this year, astrophysicist Eric W. Davis of the EarthTech International Institute for Advanced Studies said that a wormhole would be the best option for back-in-time travel. But, Davis acknowledged, it would “take a Herculean effort to turn a wormhole into a time machine.”
-Sara Gates, The Huffington Post

updates.update_userinfo: Thank You And We Will Be Back!
updates.update_content:
Thank you all for the last push yesterday and throughout the night. I have been getting a lot of messages asking if this project will still be made. I have good news...I will be relaunching The Futurist Co. Secret Society Memberships early next week! The money that is being raised for this project will go towards a mass run of the copper secret decoders. 
To all the wonderful backers of this campaign I would be beyond appreciated if you would pledge once more for the relaunch of this project. It is a passion project for me and the starting point of this new toy company, The Futurist Co. I would love for you all to be on the ground floor with me. I will be sending out the update for the relaunch early next week.

The Futurist Co. Secret Society Memberships are holding steady but we need a push to get these through! We added some cool new rewards and tiers to the campaign so go check them out! 
It's a fun and quality product and will be a staple to have in the future. Don't miss out on your chance to get in on the original and Official The Futurist Co. Secret Society Membership!

Take a peak at Wilbur Wonder's 2 new rewards! The Futurist Co. Time Capsule and The Wilbur Wonder Almanac 2018-2023!
*ALSO ADDED NEW TIER A Membership for you and a friend!

Thank you all for your generous pledges. 
I realize that we don't have a large selection of rewards to offer, but that is about to change! We are nearly half way to our goal and almost halfway til the end and we need a little boost! Keep your eyes open for some very interesting new rewards coming in the next couple of days. Also remember to tell your friends about us!
Stay Curious!

A big THANK YOU to all future members of The Futurist Co! We are excited to supply you with your decoders and membership cards. Our new toy company located in Chicago, IL is going to bring back the toys of the past with a new twist. We have a lot of upcoming projects and news to share with you. Help spread the word on this wonderful campaign and get us to our goal!

campaign.story:
I was thinking recently about those days when I'm not in the mood for small talk or big crowds, when I'm just happy to be by myself. I think just about everybody has a day like that from time to time, and can relate?
So... I thought it would be interesting to design a set of enamel pins and stickers that reflects these feelings. Something that celebrates the introvert in all of us! 
Large stickers: 
Custom shaped gloss vinyl stickers. The Selectively Social sticker will be approximately 7cm high and the Can't People Today sticker will be approximately 8cm wide.
Enamel pins:
- hard enamel
- dark metal structure 
- rubber clutch
- exclusively designed backing cards
- Selectively Social pin: 35mm high
- Can't People Today pin: 45mm wide
My name is Barbara and I am the owner and designer behind Box Monster. After working as an architect for a number of years in London and Italy, in 2016 I decided to pursue my passion for drawing and crafting. The result is Box Monster, a brand that produces unique and colourful accessories and jewellery, all designed by me!
You can find all our products in the online shop:
box-monster.com
And follow us on social medias for all the latest news, giveaways etc.:
www.instagram.com/boxmnstr
www.facebook.com/boxmnstr
www.twitter.com/boxmnstr
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Pins can take time to produce, around 3-4 weeks before they are available to post to customers. 

Within every batch of pins, there are usually some that are defective. I only ship pins that are either perfect or have tiny flaws that are almost invisible to the naked eye. It's very rare that more than 10% have defects, but if this does occur, lead times for shipping to customers may be longer.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
6 iconic soda brands, reproduced in 8 Colours, hand printed in London - Limited Edition signed screenprints.

PLUS an A2 giclee poster featuring 40 of my favourite designs.


__
  40 original and historic bottle cap designs
  styled by lalafauxbois
  Kickstarter Exclusive A2 'The Collection' Giclee Print
  Giclee Print Detail
  500mm x 500mm Fine Art Screenprints
  styled by The Pink House
 Bringing Graphic Design into people's homes
I'm Tom Love, a graphic designer and artist. This is my 6th Kickstarter Project, taking design ephemera and re-imagining them as blown-up fine art. My work has been shown across the UK as well as Berlin and Moscow.
The ProjectLike my previous five successful projects, Go Pop recognises the striking graphic narrative of the 20th Century and explores the often-overlooked relationship between art and graphic design. The Go Pop! series will bring to life my collection of vintage bottle caps, blown up in size and hand printed to produce a series of high-quality fine art.

The collection consists of 6 iconic soda brands; Coca-Cola, Pepsi, 7up, Cherry Coke, NEHI and Mello Yello. I’m also sharing 40 of my favourite designs on a Kickstarter exclusive A2 giclee printed poster.
__
500mm x 500mm Fine Art Screenprints
  Styled by The Pink House
The concept
Being able to see the beauty in everyday functional design isn't easy when we're busy going about our busy lives. That's why I want to change the context in which graphic design is viewed – by blowing them up into much bigger versions of themselves so that every tiny detail can be admired. From the use of typography to colour and form, design becomes art and begins to create an emotional reaction.
__
The Collection of 500mm x 500mm Fine Art Screenprints
Design inspired pop art printsI want more people to value the role design has in our lives and I want more people to have access to affordable, quality art that can inspire and delight them. Refreshing homes into designer pads. To do this each detail of the original bottle cap is meticulously and painstakingly reproduced for print. 
The result: a blown up bottle cap that captures the mood of an era and the beauty of graphic design. The bottle caps will be screenprinted at 500mm x 500mm, using 8 colours (including metallic inks) to form an exclusive limited edition. Each one printed on the highest quality archival paper, hand signed by the artist (Tom love) alongside the edition number, making sure each one is a collectable and covetable piece of affordable fine art. 
__
  Styled by The Pink House
  The Rewards: 
*sizes not to scale
7 Posters; 1 Giclee, 6 Fine Art Screenprints
Earlybird offer saves you over £100!
This project can't happen without a community of people who are as passionate about design as I am. That's why I'm giving Kickstarter backers a 25% discount on the RRP prices of these prints once they hit galleries and online stores.

__
Framing your prints
Give your home the contemporary art gallery feel with my cheap and easy framing hack!
I've designed all the prints so they are really simple to get framed as soon as you receive them.

The screenprints are 50cm x 50cm and can be framed straight into an Ikea Ribba frame (which comes in both black and white).
The frames are both stylish and affordable (just £9!) meaning you can have these hanging on your walls in no time.

Unfortunately, because of shipping, I can't offer these framed but if you live anywhere near and Ikea - you know what to do!
Ikea Ribba Frame

  Cherry Coke Fine Art Screenprint - Size: 500mm x 500mm

  500mm x 500mm Cherry Coke Artist Proof Detail
About me
I'm Tom Love, a graphic designer/artist born in Leicester, schooled at the renowned Falmouth College of Arts and now calling London my home.
From a very young age, I've always had a passion for design and somehow always knew I wanted to be a designer when I grew up.
This singular goal of being a designer was set in motion the day my grandad passed his stamp collection on to me. Stamps opened up a new world to me, with these tiny little pieces of paper telling stories from a world I hadn't yet explored. Through bright, colourful illustrations, photographs and typography in languages I'd never seen before, these stamps ignited my passion and love for graphic design, travel and popular culture.
From the humble beginnings of a single stamp book, I've now amassed an eclectic collection of 20th century design from cigarettes packets, stamps and matchbox labels to luggage tags and bottle caps. The beauty and balance of design at such a small, functional scale fascinates me and has led me to my art projects today.
Join me on a screenprinting adventure as I bring these fantastic examples of 20th century branding to life and into homes across the world.
__
Press
If you'd like to feature this project on your blog or news page please click below for the full Press Kit.
Downloadable Press Kit

Leo Zoghaib (Videography and photography)
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Since 2013 I have been designing and printing limited edition screenprints of my personal collection of 20th century branding and packaging design. Blowing them up in scale and producing exclusive editions which have been featured in various galleries across Europe.

This is my 6th project released on Kickstarter. 
My previous kickstarter projects have all been successfully funded.

These are high quality art prints, using only the best quality papers and inks.

I will keep all funders and supporters up-to-date with the production through regular updates - showing the complete printing process.

Posters will be mailed in sturdy Kraft Tubes and protective acid free tissue paper to protect the prints on their journey to you.

Each print will be certificated, hand signed and numbered. 
This Kickstarter will be the ONLY edition of these designs.

There are very few risks involved, but along the way plenty of challenges will throw themselves at me, as if often the case when producing something that is hand-made. I'm an experienced screenprinter and can happily guarantee the quality of each print.

Each stage of design, colour matching and printing will go through initial testing and quality control at every stage, making sure the finished prints are worthy of your walls.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter
