updates.update_content:
Hi everyone,
I’m super happy, excited and above all else RELIEVED to tell you that the Screenprints are finished, signed, numbered and have started to ship!!!
I’ve spent every spare evening and weekend since August making sure these are the best prints I have created to date. I’m so happy with them and I hope you will be too... once they’re in your hands and on your walls, I’m sure you will agree they were worth the wait.

It's been a long busy summer and I apologise for not keeping all you amazing backers up-to-date with the screenprinting progress.

I'm pleased to tell you the Pepsi 7 colour print is finished, and the Coca Cola print is awaiting it's last 2 layers of colour which has had to be postponed because of problems with the ink I was sent.
Unfortunately I am running a bit behind, mainly due to waiting on specialist inks to arrive and also booking time in the shared print studio has been tricky at best! It seems it's a busy summer for screenprinting!

I've got a bunch of printing slots booked in for September and I'm hoping all prints will be finished and ready to ship out near to the end of September, apologies for the delay and now the summer is drawing to an end, I will ensure I keep everyone regularly updated from now on.

Apologies for the radio silence the last couple of weeks.
Once the project finishes it's a bit of a waiting game for the funds to clear (takes about 2 weeks) so in that time I've been diligently planning out the costs, materials and all the boring spreadsheet bits - I won't bore you with the screenshots!
Screenprint Studio Time Booked

We did it!

We reached the goal and a whole load more!!!

Thank you everyone who supported the project in all the different ways and thank you to every single person who backed the project.
I'm going to take a couple of days off from Kickstarter to recover.
When I'm back, I will be sending out Backer Surveys so I can get a firm grip as to how many of each print has been ordered and I can start getting to work on sourcing all the various equipment needed.

Have a great weekend and you'll hear from me again next week.

There's only a few hours to go now but I'm getting quite a few people asking me how they can pledge for more than one print so I've put together a simple how to step guide below.
This assumes you've already backed for one of the rewards, if you haven't then choose one of the rewards levels you d like and follow the steps once you've made an initial pledge.
1. Click back on the Go Pop Project page

updates.update_content:
We've reached the magic number!!!!
Thanks to all the supporters of this project it's going to be a reality and I'm so excited to be able to print these designs for you all.
Yesterday I announced that I will be matching the colours on the screenprint to Pantones and as soon as the project closes I will confirm the edition numbers - they will be super exclusive and low so well done for getting yours whilst you could!

As we get SOOO close to the goal and also the end of the project I wanted to announce a little surprise for all you colour nerds (like myself) out there...

Each colour used on the screenprints will now be matched to the Pantone standards!!!

This will give each print a brighter, bolder burst of colour and ensure your prints look the very best they can!

So that's 32 different Pantone colours! AS WELL as the range of metallic inks I'll be using.
I'm going all out to make these the very best screenprints you'll find, and so you're walls are the envy of every guest you invite round.

campaign.story:
Especially when friends are around to watch a game, play poker or just to hang out, you just don't need that extra trouble. It seems to be a law of physics that you always grab the warmest drink, the one that’s just been put in the fridge! 
CoolBro breaks the laws of physics and the curse of being a warm-drink-outhander! Don't be a warm-drink-outhander, nobody likes these people ;-)
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The reason we set an ambitious funding goal is to ensure that we have everything together once the campaign ends. So we can guarantee that if we reach our funding goal, the product will roll. If we don’t, you get your money back.

Some “experts” told us: “Don’t set a high funding goal, it won’t look good.” Not with us! We are very serious about this product and even more about the people who trust us. If you think this product is worth backing, do it. Share with your friends, let’s make it a success! 
Of course there are always force majeure risks (civil unrest, wildfires, bankruptcies, etc.), which are not to be neglected in the consumer product market. We try to limit this risk by concentrating our production in a safe and boring country like Germany.

Producing here costs more, but gives us more control and provides more security for our backers. The plant is just 3 hours by car from our office in Frankfurt, not 16 plane hours away, subcontracted to someone we’ve never seen!

Our partner, Walther Faltbox System (est. 1979, www.faltbox.com), a world market leader in designing and manufacturing high-end industrial boxes and logistic solutions, is still a family business. We looked for the most reliable partner, so our backers can rely on us. Should things not go as planned – be it a delay in the manufacturing timeline, late shipping or something else – we promise to communicate honestly and work around the clock until we fix the issue.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
Continuing the success of my last project i've decided to keep up the productivity and try and release another enamel pin from the book of bare bones series!
The Wu-Tang clan was a huge part of my teenage years. 36 chambers is and continues to be one of the greatest rap albums ever made and this is my little tribute to the sound that shaped my early years as an artist drawing in the caravan at the bottom of my garden.
A new X-ray to the book of bones series - 'Wu hands'.
There'll be a stretch goal to unlock the 'Golden wu-hands" pin at £300, striclty limited to 50 pieces.
Hope you dig em! Thanks for looking!
WB
  Wu prints - 20x20cm art print on 240 gm linen paper. Signed/Stamped/numbered.

campaign.story:
Be cooler than Elon Musk: make the Mars yours already today!
We are proud to introduce first copy of martian scuplture
Backstory
Curiosity is a car-sized robotic rover exploring Gale Crater on Mars as part of NASA's Mars Science Laboratory mission. Curiosity sends images of the Martian surface.  
Conspiracy theorists have claimed to have spotted an “alien soldier” which has been spotted stalking the Curiosity Rover on Mars. The creature was spotted by Paranormal Crucible who posted the video on Youtube. The video description states: “Intriguing object which I spotted while going through the NASA archives."  
Backstory
  Figure on Mars in photos taken by Curiosity Rover
We decided deeply analyze figure: figure lines, proportions, details and design 3d model. Based on our analyze and research we decided to develop first copy of martian sculpture.
     Martian predator (image 1)
  Martian predator figure (image 2)
  Martian predator figure (image 3)
   Technical description
Rewards
  Project timeline
   And the last…  
How do you think?  
Is it only martian sculture or live martian predator photo?
  Special thanks to:
Olena Kurovets
Denis Chernyavskyy
Olga Kurovets
Serhiy Khvashchuk

campaign.story:
I'm a graphic artist and illustrator that happens to have an affinity for Thrift Store and secondhand shopping.  I love the hunt and finding cool vintage or nostalgic things, and I know plenty of other people do too.  I also collect enamel pins, and wanted to combine those passions.  
My idea is to make a series of enamel pins called Thrift Score!  A celebration of treasures found and collected by so many.  In the first set of hopefully many, I've focused on 3 things that are a staple of any good secondhand treasure hunt, Records, Artwork, and Toys!  
The idea of which is that the pin itself is a conversation starter, say you're at a flea market and you're wearing a pin of the Ghostbusters firehouse, and a someone sees it.  Next thing you know they're asking about the pin, and saying, "You know, I collect and sell vintage toys too! Why don't I show you what I have for sale "  OR you're wearing a pin with the cover of your "holy grail" record that you can't seem to find anywhere, and someone sees it and says, " Great pin! I actually have that album!"  Strike up a conversation, maybe make a new collector friend, or maybe even use it to pick up that elusive item you didn't even know they had!

The 3 pins in the initial series are as follows:

A milkcrate full of records. 1.75 in. in size available in 4 different color crates (50 of each color for 200 pcs total )  Not only do you get this great looking pin, it comes with a free sticker sheet of 8 valuable / collectible albums for you to apply to it, so the world knows what kind of music you're into / looking for.  Plus if you back at the $20.00 level, I'll make you stickers of 5 custom album covers!
Here's the 4 different colors and the 8 stickers to place on the record sleeve

A thrift store painting with a surprise, in the style of Keane.  Also limited to 200 and 1.75" tall.  These paintings are a staple of second hand and antique shops, usually of large eyed children holding pets.  But this pin contains a secret!  A paper back that can be cut open / removed to reveal a secret inside!  Maybe you get an original copy of the Declaration of Independance, an early animation cel, an antique comic book, or a stack of cash! Every pin's contents is random.  To my knowledge this is a first of it's kind, and I'm very excited to get these made!   
Here's the dimensions for the painting, and how the hollow center will work.
The special items inside will be mostly paper items, printed and placed inside.  They will be random, but I'll include a sheet of possibilities so you know how rare the one you got is.  They include, a valuable animation cel, a copy of the Declaration of Independance, A valuable old comic book, and probably a few other surprises.  All items will be miniaturized to the scale of the painting and placed inside the hollow of the pin, covered by the brown paper on the back.  


And the last pin is of The Real Ghostbusters Firehouse Playset, a staple of my childhood and a must have for any vintage toy collector!  This pin is also 1.75" and limited to 200.
Firehouse pin, the x's are the areas that will be punched out of the pin.
The pins will be manufactured by PinGameStrong.com, I've already priced out the production cost, and the turn around time is roughly 4 weeks from when the order is placed. After that 4 weeks, when I recieve the pins, it would probably take me about a week to get all of the surprises made and placed inside the paintings, and have all the stickers printed and custom ones designed and printed. Then another week to get them shipped out to everyone who pledged. There's always the chance for production delays, but I doubt it would be for more than a week or 2 tops, if any. This is my first kickstarter project, although I have had one pin / sticker manufactured in the past, so I am a little aware of all the steps involved. 
Any pins left over after all the preorders would be sold on my etsy store for varying prices, to be determined, but this is the only time to get all 3 for $25!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Honestly the only real risk here is the time it takes to be manufactured, There could be a slight delay if something goes wrong, or there's any issues with the production. Also, The hollow in the painting pin may not be up to spec the first time, the pin company says it may be a first of it's kind, so that means anything could happen, and it may add to the production time. I would keep all the backers informed with pictures and information along the way.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
This kickstarter is to help raise money to put this pair of pins into production! We are starting with just the Puppy and Kitten, and will add stretch goals if needed! These pins will feature:
Hard enamel with gold plated metal
Will be about 26mm tall for the puppy and kitten (bunny and mouse would be taller due to their ears!)
Will come with a single clutch and will be attached to a backing card
Can be bought separately, or as a cute pair to wear on your collar together!
Pins will go into production *after* the kickstarter has ended, which usually takes 3-5 weeks. Once we receive them we will pack them up and send them to you via USPS! The goal funds will go towards production, kickstarter fees, and takes into account an average defect rate. We are aiming to have them shipped by Mid-July. (One month for kickstarter to complete, then another month after kickstarter has ended to manufacture pins.)
This is our third batch of pins we will have made, you can see past pins on our instagram @minnowandmoss. Also, visit our etsy store to see reviews for past pins!
Unlocked!
*UNLOCKED!* Above are our first stretch goal pins! A cute little bunny and mouse pair! These will be unlocked if the Kickstarter reaches $1200!
Unlocked!
*UNLOCKED!* Above is our second tier stretch goal pin! This little bat will be unlocked if we reach $1700!
Unlocked!
*UNLOCKED!* Above is our third tier stretch goal pin! This purple bat is the perfect friend for the white bat and will be unlocked if we reach $2,300!
Unlocked!
*UNLOCKED!* Above is our fourth tier stretch goal pin! This little lamb will be unlocked if we reach $2,800!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
As with all kickstarters, a big risk is this project not being funded, but of course it will not cost you anything if this happens!

Other risks include production and shipping delays, or the pins varying a little from the above designs! If production or shipping delays occur, all backers will be notified! We estimate that we will be able to ship out pins 4-5 weeks after the kickstarted has ended. (This is how long production typically takes)

Estimated Timeline:
- May: Kickstarter Period
- June: Manufacturing Period
- July: Pins are shipped!

campaign.story:
As a freelance artist/designer i often need a bit of help to make things come to life. Ive found kickstarter is a great way of getting the initial funds and pre-orders to make something happen.
The Book of bare bones is an ongoing series of work in which i illustrate the skeletal structures of cartoon characters. I'm now prepping for the fourth book having just successfully funded the third (An all Simpsons special).
This project is to make these soft enamel pins of two of my favourite characters! They'll be x2 soft enamel pins with safety pin style backing. Black/white and polished nickel.
Here's the pikachu pin i made earlier this year for reference of finish on the final pins -
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Low to no risk, this will be my fifth project and i have an array of suppliers to see the project through and a lot of experience with campaigns. Fingers crossed, nothing can go wrong, apart from not getting the backing!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
Marlene and Dan from @dinohmyt coming at you again with some more fandom pins! This time, we're trying to get a set a funded. Each pin will include a different icon within a doily heart. The basic funding will get Unicorn Tina produced, but ideally we will have a set of fandom doily pins produced for our lovely Kickstarter patrons! If we do reach our stretch goals, you will be polled at the end of the Kickstarter in order to choose which pins you would like to grab (including duplicates if you really want them). 
Goals:
Unicorn Tina Enamel Pin- $325
Daft Punk Enamel Pin- $550
Childish Gambino Enamel Pin- $895
Champagne Papi Enamel Pin- $1180
 Pin Specs:  
Soft Enamel
Painted Black Nickel Plating  
2 in.  
Rubber Backs
Each pin comes with a custom backing card
Glitter/metallic enamel details
Funding Distribution:
Production: 70%
Kickstarter Fees: 10%
Shipping: 20% 
Some of our current pins in a local shop:
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
This is our second Kickstarter project, and our first Kickstarter was a huge success. We have also had 6 other pins produced and know our way around manufacturers. We know the intricacies behind producing an enamel pin. With that said, sometimes national holidays cause shipping delays, but we have added a bit of time to the expected shipping date because of this. Ideally, the pins will be in our hands (and yours) by late May.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_userinfo: Sorry backers. We need to cancel this project
updates.update_content:
According to the progress, up to 95% we will not get funded in 24 days (We have no extra money to buy agency’s service for campaign boost). We don’t want to waste our backer’s time waiting for something we know it won’t happen. 
We think admitting the fact and handle it with a positive attitude is better to give fake hope and pretending we will succeed at last.

We choose to learn from the mistakes and we will come back again very soon with better content, more suitable funding amount and much shorter duration (7-10 days).  
We give our sincere apologies to our backers, we are sorry for failing on this campaign, and deeply sorry for all the inconvenience caused. See you all again soon!

We have got 53% funded so far, thank you so much for all the backers!
Hopefully we can get fully funded soon :) 

Just a casual sharing of our work

Hi Everyone, I hope you are all doing great :) 
Today is day 2, we are getting 43% funded which is an unexpected good start to us! We wanted to take this opportunity to thank all of our backers! Thank you!! 

As you might have already noticed from our campaign description, the reason of launching this project is, because we want to let more people around the world to know more about this kind of handcraft technique, as well as our figure culture :)  And, during these two short days, I have received messages from people in different countries! For us, this is huge!! Because it means we are really on the way of reaching out to people outside Hong Kong and China (although we are not yet 100% funded, it feels like we have already did! :P) !!

Thanks to all your love and support, the final stretch goal (Floral Moon) has now been unlocked and is selectable as a reward!
Thank you to each and every one of you who pledged or took the time to take a look~ without you, this Moon Forest Animals pin series would not have been possible. Reminder that there's a sweet discount if you grab the complete set of 5 pins.
Not long left to go now! There's just under a week before the Kickstarter campaign ends, eep!

Rounding off the Moon Forest Animals pin series is the Floral Moon, featuring the crescent moon against the night sky and floral motif.
The word “crescent” comes from the Latin term ceres meaning to “bring forth, create” and crescere, the Latin term for “grow, thrive”. This pin symbolises growth and creativity, combining the magical forces of the moon and the blossoming world around us.
Just a reminder, the complete 5 pin set is available at a special discounted reward tier!

updates.update_userinfo: Complete Moon Forest Animals Series Unlocked!
updates.update_content:
You guys are awesome!! Thank you so much to each and every one of you for your support. Without you, this wouldn't be possible.
Here are all of the unlocked designs of the Moon Forest Animals pin series! There's one final stretch goal to round off this series, the Floral Moon.
A new reward tier has been added for the complete series, so you can grab all 5 pins at a special price!

The 4th design in this Moon Forest Animals pin series is the Moon Bear, who is already at 82% funded!
The bear symbolizes strength, wisdom and courage. The bear is a protector, and is generally feared and admired at the same time. Let this Moon Bear be a reminder of your inner strength and courage in staying true to yourself, despite what may be going on in the world around you.

Wow you guys!! Thanks to all your love, Moon Wolf has now been unlocked and is available to be selected as a reward!
Other stretch goals have also been unveiled so if you want to take a peek at the other designs from this series, please do!
Thanks again to every single one of you for all your support! xx

Stretch Goal Target £3000
Elder Sign Badge!
ALL BACKERS (apart from folk selecting the No Reward pledge level) will recieve the Elder Sign badge completly FREE as part of their rewards!
History of the Elder Sign
The Elder Sign is a protective ward. Invoked as a hand gesture, it serves the same function as protection against the evil eye or crossing oneself —comforting, but ultimately without benefit. Carved into something solid—rock, glass, wood, or even precious metal—enchanted with magic, and worn openly, it provides a defense against the minions of the Great Old Ones.
--------------------------------------------
Welcome to our Kickstarter for a set of soft enamel badges featuring some of the most infamous Cthulhu Mythos books ever read by scholars of elder lore! Show your knowledge of the Mythos by displaying these badges on your person, dice bag, game gear, or even a hat!
We are looking for your backing to fund this set of badges!
The Necronomicon displayed on a dice bag.
We have just one pledge level for this Kickstarter. If you're quick to the party, however, you can get the badge set at a small discount! This early bird will not be available after the first 24 hrs.

This set of five badges are made from die struck metal and soft enamel colors. Each badge comes with a butterfly catch.
Designed in house at Triple Ace Games, the Mythos Badges are a unique collectible item. These exclusive badges will only be available from this Kickstarter and if in stock from our trade stand at conventions. We won't be making them available in our online store after this Kickstarter ends!
Necronomicon Book Badge
Arguably the most damnable document ever penned in the history of humanity, the Necronomicon concerns matters and entities beyond the understanding of sane men. It speaks of elder gods and spaces between reality, of insidious words that can drive men to madness, of lost cities inhabited by creatures that defy the laws of nature, and of a time before time when terrible things walked upon the earth and swam in the sea. It is a book from which a magician might acquire great power, if he is prepared to pay the terrible price.
Unaussprechlichen Kulten Book Badge
Written by Friedrich Wilhelm von Junzt (1795-1840) and published in 1839, the text (also known as the Black Book) details a number of vile cults. Some appear fictional, their existence being placed at a date before the accepted creation of the first civilizations. Others concern more recent, yet no less barbaric cults.
King in Yellow Book Badge
The King in Yellow is a forbidden play. Its name is well known to actors through hearsay and gossip, yet few have ever seen a copy. Even so, it is greatly feared among thespians. Written in two acts for three characters, Cassilda, Camilla, and the King in Yellow (a malevolent supernatural figure of mysterious origin), merely the act of reading the play can cause madness or despair.
Cultes des Goules Book Badge
Denounced by the Church on its publication, this text graphically exposes the vile arts of necromancy, necrophagy, and necrophilia practiced by a cult in France.
Cthulhu Cultist Badge
The cult of dread Cthulhu has existed since the dawn of mankind and continues to plot the ascension of its master to this day. In order that cultists might recognize each other, they sport pins or tattoos of the abominable Great Old One.
We understand that you may wish to get 2,3 or even 4 sets of badges! So we've got you covered - we've even give you a little saving on extra sets!
How do you include add-ons? Well that super easy! If you've already pledged, just click on MANAGE MY PLEDGE and add the extra amount required to get your desired add-ons!
When you pledge shipping will not be included during the Kickstarter campaign. We will be using Backerkit to manage the surveys and shipping costs once the campaign ends.
We'll send you a survey link to Backerkit once the campaign ends and shipping and any add-ons will be calculated in Backerkit.
The shipping will be the following:
UK = FREE SHIPPING
EU = £2
USA & Canada = £3
ROW  = £3
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The design and all of the artwork has been completed for the badges, so we know exactly what will be going into the final product. We also have a great deal of experience in the field of games publishing and manufacturing items like these badges.

However, things can go wrong with anything that goes into a manufacturing process. We have identified that delays in manufacturing could happen. So we have allowed additional time in our schedule to enable us to navigate any delay issues. If all goes to plan, we may even be able to deliver the project a little sooner.

With projects like this there is nearly always something that costs more so it is good business sense to have some contingency for this, which we have built in to our costs.

No matter what problems may occur we will always keep our backers and supporters informed of all issues so that you are aware of the situation and how we are dealing with it.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
Everyone has seen many jokes and videos made about the lack of phone jack on iPhone 7. You could put a 3.5 mm to a lightning adapter, but that would mean you cannot charge the phone at the same time.
 Traditional iPhone 7 Music & Charging solution 
Change : The "RES" Perfect Hi-Res Music Solution for iPhone 7
The RES converter was designed as a solution for dual charging and listening. Instead of purchasing completely new add-ons, The RES external digital-to-analog converter (Hi-Res DAC 24 bits 192kHz) attaches to 3.5mm jack and lightning ports, allowing you to play audio and stay charged around the clock.
RES contains a 3.5 mm headphone jack and a lightning charging port and Qi Wireless Charging, enabling you to listen to music and charge your iPhone at the same time.
 Why You Need RES, The Truly 24bit 192kHz Hi-Res Upscale not like others Descale devices! 
PLAY

Apple iPhone 7, users have kicked up a fuss, and rightly so, by the fact that there is no port for their high-quality headphones. This created a unique gap in the market for new technology. In steps RES. This cost effective, 3 in 1 converter lets every user keep their original headphones. RES provides the ultimate sleek alternative, that’s no muss, no fuss.
Introducing a dual functioning, Wire or Wireless charge and listening add-on isn’t exactly groundbreaking. However, it’s unique selling points make RES the most portable, efficient and cost-effective converter on the market.
RES+ integrated Qi Wireless charging receiver 
RES+ : Wireless charging functionality without an extra bulk or case, which is pretty awesome.
Forget about cables! RES : replaces your cables by charging your devices wirelessly. Simply place your device on it and let the magic happen.
No software to install. Simply plug and play.
Now, you can listen to music via your phone and Wire or Qi Wireless charge your phone all at the same time.
  RES - Black or White Colour for your optional
Res-Plug-in
Name of Professional “High-Resolution Audio” : “Hi-Res Audio” 
The product with this logo has been designed to maximize the sound performance of High Resolution Audio*.*High-resolution audio generally refers to music data with a volume of information exceeding that of CDs.
Your Phone become a Hi-Res Digital Audio Player
The state-of-the-art way to enjoy Hi-Res entertainment on the move... An Entertainment Player without limits RES has blazed an 'end to end' trail for Hi-Res audio, including content from the iTunes Music download service, a series of award-winning hi-res software apps, as well as our huge range of hi-res amplifiers, AVRs, portable headphone amps, headphones, and loudspeakers. To that list, RES is now adding its first Hi-Res digital audio player (DAP). And it's anything but ordinary.
Truth be told, we couldn’t imagine smartphones without a 3.5mm audio jack so that’s why we created RES to ease users into the transition. RES has the potential of becoming a must have add-on for your new smartphone, especially if you want to keep your original high-end headphones.
NOTHING COMES BETWEEN YOU AND YOUR MUSIC
Experience what it's like to leave the noise behind. You'll feel it at the flip of a switch—noise fades, and your music soars.
Pure Sound for music lovers
Give your music the purity if deserves. With a frequency range extending up to 100kHz, the RES Hi-Resolution DAC capture the true essence of each track - so you'll hear music that's closer to the original studio master. From deep beats to soaring vocals, sound stays true for an authentic and precise experience.
RES NOISE CANCELLING DAC ARE ENGINEERED WITH WORLD-CLASS TECHNOLOGY SO NOTHING COMES BETWEEN YOU AND YOUR MUSIC. The next generation of noise cancellation.
Experience what it's like to leave the noise behind. You'll feel it at the flip of a switch—noise fades, and your music soars. That's the power of our RES Noise Cancelling technology, which continuously measures, compares and reacts to outside noise—then cancels it with the opposite signal. And perfect with Hi-End headphones, we've added another breakthrough technology: controllable noise cancellation that lets you choose how much of the world you want to let in.
Professional Audio Expert Advice
friendly no-hassle help Audio Expert, learn more about Hi-Res Audio
 Tending the Vine (24-Bit Audio Collection)
Also Available with MicroUSB or USB-C

One I2S/PCM/TDM digital interface supports sample rates 8k, 16k, 22.05k, 32k, 44.1k, 48k, 96k and 192kHz

campaign.story:
PLAY

Greetings Kickstarter Friends!
I'm Kim (@heremeow on IG) and I'm so excited about this collaboration with Tommy (@toymations). If you were a kid or teen of the 90s you may remember coming home from school, grabbing a snack and binge watching cartoons before your parents made you do your homework. Together we chose some of our all time favorite 90s kids shows and packed as much nostalgia as we could into a 1.75" spinning pin!
Turn the dial and the TV image will change to your choice of Pokemon, Batman: The Animated Series, Power Rangers or Animaniacs! 
FEATURES:
Neon purple and blue Pantone swatches to show a TV-lit living room
2 Pin backs to keep the pin in place
1.75" of detailed artwork
Black soft enamel
Custom backing card
Ships worldwide for $3.00!
 THE ARTWORK:
Artist's Mock Up
PRODUCTION:
Turn around time for production is about two weeks. Once, the kickstarter is funded we will begin production and get these to you by the beginning of April.  
HOW'S IT MADE?:
The pin consists of 3 circles, the top layer (living room), middle layer (the turning wheel of TV shows) and back layer metal circle that has the pin backings affixed. This makes sure that the middle layers spins while pinned in place.

campaign.story:
“If thou but settest foot on this path, thou shalt see it everywhere.” 
― Hermes Trismegistus
The Great Work begins with two symbols of traditional alchemy, mercury and sulfur presented as 1.5" soft enamel lapel pins. These pins combine a black soft enamel with a shining nickel finish to make stylish and subtle accessories to any ensemble. They will be shipped to you on a backing card bearing the Strix Publishing logo, appropriate for gift giving.
Drawn from Strix Publishing's upcoming art book, APOCRYPHA: The Art of Jason Soles, this set of symbols is the work of talented designer Iphigenia, of Foie Gras. This Kickstarter campaign's graphic design is the work of longtime Strix Publishing contributor, Ed Bourelle, of SkeletonKey Games.
All 7 additional pin stretch goals have been unlocked. Thank you!
If you would like to back for multiples of a single pin design please send a PM and you'll be given your choice after the campaign ends. 
Different monitors may present these mockup pins in differing sizes. Actual production size is 1.5" x 1.3"
  Called “quicksilver” by the ancients, mercury is one of the three primes of alchemy and one of the seven planetary metals. Associated with spirit, mercury represents the transcendence of states. Mercury is both solid and liquid, heaven and earth.
Sulfur is also one of the tria prima, the fundamental aspects of human identity as defined by the alchemist Paracelsus. Sulfur was believed to embody the emotions and desires of humanity, separate from the higher faculties of the spirit. This variant of the sulfur symbol is also known as the Leviathan Cross. 
Whether in terms of practical chymistry or as a metaphorical journey of personal transformation, the ultimate application of alchemy is the transmutation of base materials into gold. Gold represents the perfection of all matter, all states. Mind, spirit, and soul, when refined will become this superlative metal. The symbol for gold is also used in astrology to represent the sun.
Earth is one of the four Hellenic elements of ancient Greek ghilosophy, one of the founding bodies of knowledge upon which classical alchemy was based. It is associated with concepts of solidity, immovability, and the physical world. Its associations with ancient mystery cults and cthonic deities has also lent it significance in matters of sensuality and death.
Invert the symbol of earth to use it as the symbol of air. This symbol is linked with the atmosphere and its resultant weather, and is associated with intelligence as one of the Hellenic elements. More recent occult traditions have linked the element of air with elemental entities known as sylphs. The Hermetic Order of the Golden Dawn associates air with the eastern cardinal point in ritual, guarded by the First Watchtower.
Antimony is an unusual element known to mankind since the most distant times when pre-dynastic Egyptians used it to create kohl eyeliner. To the alchemist, antimony is a cooperative metal, best used in combination with another metal such as lead to produce complex reactions. In alchemical terms it is a protective metal—though scientifically classified as a metalloid—and associated with concepts of adaptability and cooperation. It represents the wisdom and strength gained by the sharing of strength and unique talent. Antimony further represents the balance of animal nature within the human spirit and when worn as a sigil is a potent reminder of inner strength.
One of the most abundant elements in the universe, and another of the seven metals of alchemy, iron is associated with concepts of aggression and power. This symbol is also used in astrology to signify the planet Mars. As a sigil, use it to manifest emotions of confidence, physicality, strength, and lust. Iron is the metal most closely associated with the "human" state and is therefore anathema to spirits and disincarnate entities.
Arsenic is a notorious metalloid that was utilized in many alchemical processes and today it is a common element used in the production of pesticides, herbicides, insecticides, and many industrial alloys. Traditionally, the alchemists treated arsenic with a wary respect. Despite its toxicity it was a necessary element in many medicinal and magickal cures. Indeed, it is said that a compound of arsenic and sulfur could induce enlightening trances...Wear the symbol of arsenic when you wish to wield the strength of poison and ward off unwanted advances.
Lead is the the prima matera, the primal matter. The basest element, it represents the putrefaction and decay necessary for new life. Alchemy is concerned with the transformation from base to pure and therefore lead is as important to the alchemist as gold. In astrology, the alchemical metal of lead is associated with the god Saturn and therefore concepts of generation, dissolution, plenty, wealth, periodic renewal and liberation. This symbol mimics the scythe of Saturn, and bears a shape in parts derived from the old Hebrew letter Taw, and the ancient Greek Tau.
The strix was a flesh eating bird of ill-omen, walking on four taloned legs, and bearing a razor-sharp beak, in the myths of the ancient Greeks. The earliest known tale of the strix is from Metamorphoses in which Polyphonte and her sons Agrios and Oreios were punished for acts of cannibalism. Polyphone was cursed to becom a creature "that cries by night, without food or drink, with head below and tips of feet above, a harbinger of war and civil strife to men." References to the strix are found throughout the surviving works of antiquity through the days of the Roman Empire and survived into the middle ages, where its name became entangled with the Romanian word for vampire, strigoi, and creatures that scream in the night like the Strigăt barn owl.
Add-ons
If you'd like to order more pins than alloted in the rewards simply click the “manage your pledge” button on the project page. Then, increase your pledge by $10 per additional pin.

The designs for the pins are finished, quotes have been obtained, and we will be able to place our orders the day the Kickstarter funds are made available to us.

updates.update_userinfo: Under the Black Flag - Historical pirate flags as enamel pins now on Kickstarter from the creator of The Great Work
updates.update_content:
Hello all,
Thanks again for your support in the past! I hope you're as well as can be in this turbulent era.  I thought I'd let you know that I've got a new Kickstarter for another line of historical occult symbols, this time focusing on the crude but compelling iconography of the Golden Age of Piracy. Under the Black Flag is already funded and cruising towards its second stretch goal. 
Cheers!

updates.update_userinfo: The Great Work begins anew! New alchemical symbol pins on Kickstarter now.

updates.update_content:
I can happily inform you that fulfillment has been completed and all rewards have been mailed! Domestic backers will naturally receive their rewards sooner than international backers but I expect all rewards will arrive by the end of this month. 
If you have not received your reward by July 1st, or your rewards are incorrect, please contact me privately and I'll take care of any issues ASAP.
The pins are now available in the Strix Publishing web store. You'll notice they retail for $12 instead of $10 now, but as a final "thank you" for your support, please use code:  GREATWORKBACKER to receive 10% off your order of anything in the web store. This code is good through 07/31.
The pins have arrived and they're beautiful!

As of today, the quotes have been finalized, designs approved, and the pins have been ordered! 
The pins should arrive in approximately 8 weeks, at which time I'll update the Kickstarter and give you all a final chance to update your shipping addresses if needed. The next step for me is to order the backing cards on which the pins will be affixed and enough shipping mailers for the initial reward mailings.

Thanks to 201 of you, the Great Work closed out at 430% funded! Thank you all so much. 
Here's what happens next.
You'll receive surveys via Kickstarter within the next ten days or so at which time you'll have the opportunity to let me know any substitutions you may like in your selection of pins.
Roughly two weeks from now I'll receive the funds from Kickstarter. Once they're transferred to my bank account I'll place the pin order based on the results of the survey.

Sorry for the second update in short order but I neglected an item from the previous update. 
If you like pins, mythology, and symbols of occult significance as I imagine most of you do, I'd like to direct your attention to this other Kickstarter also wrapping up right now...

campaign.story:
A campaign to fund a new resin sculpt and some stickers.
I made my first sculpt last year to co-inside with my second solo exhibition 'the Peopel & Other Works' at Brush Gallery, Brighton. I made a small edition of 15, which is now sold out.
The idea was to bring these characters off their pages and make them real, or at least solid. These simple human forms have been the basis of much of my work for a few years now.
I'm often asked what they are, and what they mean to me.
To me they are humanity broken down to its most basic form. Ego-less, Race-less, Gender-less, without bias or hatred and live to love each other and the earth.
Every aspect of these sculpts are hand made. They are created using a polymer clay, baked, then roto cast by my friend Ewan (Hollow Planet Designs). The finish is very much that of the original model, all bumps and dents included, they are by no means a perfect manufactured toy, on purpose!
Another aspect of this campaign is your chance to own one of the previously sold out sculpt No.1. These will be a second edition, to separate them from the first they'll be black.
Thanks for reading! Keep up to date with me on instagram @willbloodartist
WB
Sculpt No.1 -
 Sculpt No.1 & Sculpt No.2 model before casting -
 'LICENTIA' Screenprint, A2 42X59cm -

campaign.story:
A photographic document of all the remaining Pie and Mash shops in London. A limited edition photo book with only 100 printed copies.
As part of Kickstarters MAKE/100 project we are limiting our campaign to 100 backers. 
Pie and Mash London is a documentary of London’s historic pie and mash tradition. Pie and mash is a traditional London working-class food, originating in London. Pie, mash and eel shops have been in London since the 19th century, and are still common in East and South East London and in many parts of Kent and Essex.
The aim of this project is to fund the printing of 100 limited edition A5 landscape books. We will make 100 signed copies available to backers of this kickstarter campaign. When it has been successfully funded we will print an extra 30 unsigned and unnumbered editions and donate them to each of the pie and mash shops as reference copies.
Why this? Why now? 
In 2015 Jake Green and Simon Poon Tip decided to collaborate to produce Pie and Mash a film as part of the 32LDN creative project. During that documentary project Jake took stills at each shop, documenting each exterior. The result is a limited edition collection of photography that serves as a directory of pie and mash shops in London and a printed accompaniment to the film they produced.
As life-long inhabitants of London, Simon Poon Tip and Jake Green have witnessed the continued development of the city over the years, something that inspired them to capture this freeze frame in pie and mash history. Since shooting the film between 2014 and 2015, four of the featured pie and mash shops have closed down. They have been included in this printed edition as a reference to the changing face of London’s pie and mash culture. 
A mock-up of the letter pressed cover
This limited edition photobook designed by the Bread Collective will have an editorial contribution from John Rogers and hand printed letter press editions by Russell Frost of Hooksmith Press.
The book itself will be digitally printed and saddle stitched by Park Communications with a GF Smith cover in Lockwood Green Colourplan and a title hand letterpressed in black ink on the cover. 
A mock-up of the gold foiled cover
The book will consist of 40 pages including 30 B+W images of the exterior of every single remaining pie and mash shop in London.
John Rogers is a writer, film-maker and author of This Other London - Adventures in the Overlooked City.
Bread Collective are an award-winning design collective based in East London.
Russell Frost is a letterpress artist running Hooksmith Press, a small letter press shop based in East London.
Jake Green is freelance photographer based in London, author of The Bookmaker’s Studio
Simon Poon Tip is a D&AD and BRIT award winning creative producer.
32LDN is a project directed by Simon Poon Tip that aims to collectively build a picture of today's London, through the participation of people from all walks of life.
We would also like to thank www.pie-n-mash.com a great resource for us while we were planning our documentary.
Tower Bridge pie and mash shop. Opened in 1892.
A layout example of the final book
The names of all the shops included
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
There aren't many risks involved in this project, other than if you’re too slow in getting hold of a copy of this lovely little short run first edition then you risk missing out.

All the pictures have been taken, texts nearly written, all layouts designed. It is VERY unlikely that anything will go wrong. This book will be printed quickly digitally and then painstakingly hand letter pressed by Russell Frost or hand gold foiled. If we don’t get funding then who knows when this collection of historic images will get published.

campaign.story:
The Getaway Bag: All-Weather Duffle
by Rickshaw Bagworks
Hello Kickstarters! We're pleased to present our new bag project — the All-Weather Getaway Bag — our modern interpretation of the classic square duffle, featuring high-tech waterproof xPac sailcloth, splash-proof zippers, and a sleek, compact, lightweight design.
The Duffle features an external quick access pocket and four interior pockets to keep you organized — along with a matching xPac Dopp Kit for toiletry items and Utility Pouch for electronics accessories, journal and writing instruments or general miscellany.
REWARDS:
The Duffle, Dopp Kit and Utility Pouch are available separately, or in a 3-piece Collection. The Getaway Collection has all the essentials for your everyday carry, your gym routine, or your next getaway.
We're offering two styles: the Standard Edition, with black xPac exterior and grey nylon packcloth interior, and the Money Edition with black xPac exterior, and a custom printed $100 "Money" liner.
We're also offering a make/100 Gold Label Money Edition with black xPac exterior, the Money liner and special gold accent labels. The make/100 Edition is limited to one hundred 3-piece sets, at a once-in-a-lifetime price of $100. There is also a $100 Early Bird Special on the Standard 3-piece collection.
NEW REWARD:
Color Edition: Black xPac exterior with your choice of Red, Orange, Yellow, Green, Blue or Purple nylon packcloth interior.
Color Edition: Choose one of six interior colors

If you live in or near San Francisco, and would like to pick up your reward at our factory to save on the shipping fee, please select Antarctica as your shipping country. We will hold all Antarctica shipments at our San Francisco headquarters for Will Call pick-up. Our office hours are M-F, 10-5.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
We make our bags in our own factory, right here in San Francisco, and we've been in business for ten years — so we know how to get this job done. We were successful with our five previous Kickstarter projects, and met our delivery schedules. We have everything we need to get started, so once funded, we're ready to print, cut and sew. If pledges exceed our expectations, the production may take a little longer than expected, but we'll keep you updated all along the way. Thanks for your support!

Hello Backers. Thanks for your enthusiasm for The Getaway Bag. It has been just 24 hours since the launch, and the make/100 Gold Label and Early Bird Special reward levels are sold out. Regardless, all of the rewards represent a significant savings over retail pricing, so every backer is a winner! Please spread the word to your friends.
Meanwhile, I welcome any comments or suggestions you might have for this campaign, or future projects. I did not plan any "stretch goals", and I try to keep the reward options nice and simple — but some of the best ideas come from enthusiastic supporters like you, so feel free to share.

campaign.story:
I am not pleased with the current occupant of the White House.  Many other people in the United States and around the world aren't too keen on him either.  
PLAY

We have gone forward in so many ways: equality for women, Civil Rights, and LGBT rights.  We cannot allow that progress to be halted and must fight to retain those gains while we continue the struggle. 
They must respect our existence or expect resistance.
The call to resist this administration has been heard by millions.  I think it's important to have a symbol for that resistance. 
Electrical Resistor Symbol
In electronic circuits, resistors are used to reduce current flow, adjust signal levels, to divide voltages, bias active elements, and terminate transmission lines, among other uses. [source]
Resistors against the new administration can serve the same purpose.  
This pin is a visible statement you can wear to show where you stand vis-à-vis the current president of The United States. 
AGAIN, They must respect our existence or expect resistance.
Wearing your pin is a reminder of who we are and that we intend to move forward.

My name is Jeremy Burnich.  I am a designer and my company is JOY COMPLEX. I am based in Pittsburgh, PA and have collaborated with artists from around the world. 
Social awareness in design is important to me.
I have created armor pendants that benefit Women for Afghan Women, dolphin rings that benefit the Whale & Dolphin Conservation Society and jewelry that supports reproductive rights.

updates.update_content: Hello everyone!  Just wanted to shamelessly plug my Merry Resistmas shirts for the holiday season.

A REACTION
By now we all know about the mass shooting in Las Vegas.  If we are going to change how guns are viewed in the United States we need to stand up to the NRA and let gun owners know that gun rights aren't absolute rights. The 2nd Amendment is an amendment to the US Constitution.  By it's very nature it's something that can be changed.

The ineptitude of donald trump knows no bounds. His utter incapacity to actually govern during a crisis is threatening the lives of American citizens in Puerto Rico. We need to look out for our own since the current occupant of the White House is too busy tweeting about non-issues. To that end I’m doing something.

As you all know, there is some even MORE crazy stuff happening in Washington than there was when I last posted an update.  Instead of going over everything - as if I had the time to collect and annotate every misstep and egregious action by the current occupant of the White House and his administration - I thought I would share this powerful post by Dan Rather.  
______________________________________________________________________________

By now, many of you will have received your RESISTOR pins.  I've been getting a lot of positive feedback from those that have - and a few photos on social media!  (It's very neat to see these pins out in the world!)
On January 27, I said that (unlike Trump and his taxes) when the campaign was over and all the pins were mailed out that I'd let you know where the money went.  
Well, the pins are mailed out (mostly) and I think I can let you know where the money went.  Here's the breakdown:
Hello everyone! The pins arrived today! I opened the box from True Metal Works and was very pleased with the results. Here’s a fun animation of the pin.

campaign.story:
Hi!
To those in the Know, this is the 3rd installment of the Book of bare bones. A book of illustrations stripping back the worlds favourite characters to their bare bones! Im constantly asked to do characters from this series so i thought it'd be nice to do a small homage and pick some favourites to skeleton-ise. As before, im open to suggestions, so please let me know if there's any characters you want to see!
The book itself will be 'Zine' style, stapled with thick covers as opposed to bound as before.
I know its an awkward time financially (im self employed, and skint!) so ive kept the reward costs low and the money wont be taken until a while after the campaign ends in February.
Find me here - @thebookofbarebones on instagram
Thanks for looking!
WB
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
This will be my third time producing these or similar items, as much as i feel like i know what im doing ive still allowed further more time to make sure i can hit deadlines and avoid any disappointment! The first two have been very successful with many happy backers!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

Hi all, was very excited to get my delivery slot today and opened the box eagerly in anticipation.
However, of the 4 out of ten boxes ive opened, two are trimmed wrong with empty spaces where they shouldn't be and one is in the wrong order... I'm absolutely heartbroken, its taken weeks of work to get this far! I'm not sure how you can get something like this wrong in two different ways and also get some right?

Hi everyone, to those that don't know I've just launched a new Kickstarter campaign - It's not the Simpsons, but it is wu-tang! Enamel pins up for preorder now via Kickstarter. There's some early bird deals available, all very affordable. Have a great weekend!

Hi all, just wanted to let you know im on schedule to have everything out the week after next! The zines are also limited to 500 and each will be numbered based on the order of backing!
I'm also entering the last couple of hours of my campaign for the Itchy & Scratchy pins, they've also nearly sold out! Back the campaign (quick) HERE!

Keep your eyes peeled for the surveys going out soon.....

campaign.story:
You've met with a terrible fate, haven't you?
Majora’s Mask took the basic framework that Ocarina of Time had been built upon and made everything that little bit smarter, that little bit darker and that little bit weirder.
It’s that weirdness - the sense of dread and the unnerving tone that permeates its entire experience - that made Majora's Mask resonate with so many N64 players. The recent remake for the Nintendo 3DS is testament to its timelessness as the game, along with its transformation and time travel mechanics, holds up just as well today.
Pins
To celebrate my love for Majora’s Mask, I’ve designed a set of 3 enamel pins representing the 3 core transformations Link undergoes throughout his adventure - The Deku Scrub, the Goron and the Zora. These will be black nickel plated, 4 colour, hard enamel pins.
Poster
To accompany the pins, I’ve also designed a poster inspired by Majora’s Mask. Risograph printed here in Edinburgh by Workhorse Press on 200GSM A3 uncoated off-white recycled paper.
Early Adopters
And that’s not everything. You super speedy early adopters will also get a totally free Bunny Hood badge. My, what long ears you have…
Pins and posters all ship worldwide!
Depending on the success of this campaign, I’ll also be looking to design some more mask pins and I’ll be consulting with backers to determine what’s next!
Believe in your strengths... Believe...
(The Legend of Zelda is a registered trademark of Nintendo of America)
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
With years of professional design and illustration practice behind me, I am confident that there will be very few risks involved with a relatively straightforward project like this. I would hope to have the finished pins and posters with backers by mid-March 2017, allowing for production time and shipping. However, this will of course vary country to country.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Hi all,
I've been in contact with a handful of you directly but I figured it probably makes a lot more sense to post an update.
I am happy to say that all of the rewards have been shipped out! I know that many of you in the UK and Europe have already received them and I hope that those further afield should get theirs in the next few days.

Hello all!
Thank you for your patience so far! I can confirm that the pins are in and ready to go and they look great - I can't wait for you all to get your hands on them!
My apologies for the holdup with shipping. It has been the posters that have caused the delay. After a string of misunderstandings, miscommunication and less-than-perfect prints, we are now going ahead with our third printer - the superb Hato Press in London. Full disclosure: I had initially been very keen to use Work Horse Press here in Edinburgh, but we had difficulties with scheduling. We then went ahead with Risotto in Glasgow but unfortunately their prints were just not up to the standard I wanted and that you should all expect. Hato Press are arguably the best Risograph printers in the UK and I'm confident that these new posters will be awesome.

Hey backers!
There has been little in the way of updates as I've been patiently waiting for the Kickstarter funds to transfer over but today I can confirm that production will start imminently on the badges and we're still on track to ship them out in March!
Thanks again and watch this space!

Hey everyone,
With just 6 hours to go, I find myself overwhelmed by the success of the campaign! There's still time to spread the word so keep it up!
Thanks again to everyone who's backed so far and yes, I've heard y'all: I'll be looking at more masks real soon so watch this space...

So with 21 days left to go, we've hit our funding goal! Thank you to everyone who has already supported the campaign and thank you to any and all future supporters. We've still got plenty of time left to push it even further and start looking at some other masks so pelase do spread the word and watch this space.
Thanks again!
Chris
